title: Customer Support Specialist
description:
Role Summary



The Customer Support Specialist is the primary point of contact for members, leaders, nonprofits, partners, and

clients. This role combines deep technical troubleshooting within our proprietary admin panel with high-empathy

community engagement. You will ensure that donation cycles are accurate, leadership transitions are seamless, and every

user experience reflects our core values of trust and transparency. You will work within a highly collaborative environment,

sharing execution and strategic responsibilities with the Community Team, with the support of Growth, Accounts, and

Product teams to ensure seamless platform operations.



Operations & Technical Support

? Technical Ticket Resolution: Manage
 inquiries and voi
s in Hubspot, prioritizing tickets based on

urgency and user type (e.g., Client vs. Partner vs. Leader vs. Member).

? Database & Records Management: Utilize Admin Panel to manage Users, Memberships, Donations,

Subscriptions, Post Submissions, Funds, and other backend data to resolve account adjustments and discrepancies.

? Financial Operations Support: Execute refunds via Stripe, cancel duplicate subscriptions, and move donations

between "Pools" to ensure accurate fund allocation.

? Integrity & Compliance: Review all newly created Giving Circles daily to determine legitimacy and ensure proper

internal tagging.

? Security & Mitigation: Proactively identify and deactivate "spammy" groups and user accounts.

? Content Moderation: Inspect posts and submissions, including text and video content for profanity and brand

compliance before they are shared with donors.





Community & Leader Success

? Leader Onboarding: Review new leader applications, manage the "Leader Buddy Matching" program, and monitor

peer learning cohorts to ensure new leaders are supported.

? Community Engagement: Monitor and respond to community posts and social media comments

(LinkedIn/Facebook/Instagram) to maintain an active, welcoming environment.

? At-Risk Intervention: Regularly update the "Circle At-Risk" tracker and provide hands-on support to groups where

leaders have resigned or have become non-responsive.

? Churn Mitigation: Identify "churned" groups (those that have stopped donating) and execute weekly outreach to

encourage reactivation.

Resource & Events Coordination

tools to fulfill data requests from the CEO, internal teams, and customers.

 templates),

title: Accounting Assistant – Home Healthcare
description:
We are a growing home healthcare company looking for a reliable and experienced Accounting Assistant to support our finance and accounting operations. This is a remote, full-time position where you will work closely with our team to keep our books accurate, our vendors paid, and our staff compensated on time.



RESPONSIBILITIES:

- Process and manage accounts payable, including vendor invoices, expense reports, and payment scheduling

- Process payroll for home health aides, coordinators, and administrative staff accurately and on time

- Reconcile bank statements, credit card accounts, and general ledger entries

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date records in QuickBooks and other accounting systems

- Assist with accounts receivable, including tracking outstanding balances and following up on payments

- Record and categorize daily financial transactions

- Prepare and assist with month-end and year-end close processes

- Generate financial reports and summaries for management review

- Assist with tracking and managing employee time records and PTO in coordination with HR/scheduling

- Ensure compliance with applicable accounting standards and company financial policies

- Support audits and provide documentation as needed

- Perform other general accounting and administrative tasks as assigned



REQUIREMENTS:

- Minimum 2 years of accounting or bookkeeping experience, preferably in a healthcare or homecare setting

- Proficiency in QuickBooks (Online) is required

- Experience with Sage accounting software is a strong plus

- Solid understanding of accounts payable, payroll processing, and general bookkeeping principles

- High attention to detail and accuracy with numbers and financial data

- Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines

- Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

- Ability to work independently and proactively in a remote environment

- Reliable high-speed internet connection and a quiet, professional workspace

- Proficiency with Google Workspace and/or Microsoft Office (especially Excel/Sheets)



WHAT WE OFFER:

- Competitive salary based on experience

- Stable, long-term remote position with a growing home healthcare company

- Collaborative and supportive team culture

- Opportunity for growth within the company



If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please submit your resume, a brief description of why you believe you would be a good fit for this role, and a short video of you telling us why you are the best and what sets you apart from the others. You must submit a video and you must have the subject line of your application include the phrase: "Your problems are over".

title: Experienced Full Cycle Accountant
description:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Accountant / Bookkeeper to provide comprehensive support across various financial domains in our company. This remote, freelance position requires expertise in handling Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable and reconciliation.



The ideal candidate will be proactive, efficient, and committed to timely and accurate financial reporting and management.

- Record to Report (R2R): Help maintain accurate records of all financial transactions and ensure compliance with accounting standards and legal requirements. Support the generation of reports that offer insights into the financial health of the business.

- Excellent organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively.

- Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.

- Effective communication skills, capable of handling interactions with tea
mbers and external partners.



Additional Information:

- Start your application with the word: CoFE in the header to ensure you read the entire description

- Immediate availability is preferred.

- Candidates should include a detailed resume and a brief cover letter outlining relevant experience and qualifications.

title: Full-Time Video Editor + Content Manager (YouTube + Shorts + Thumbnails)
description:
Company: The Milner Team at Florida Future Realty (Southwest Florida)

Location: Remote (US or International)

Type: Full-Time (40 hrs/week)

Schedule: Very flexible but I request a few hours of overlap for quick tasks.

Pay: Salary/flat weekly pay (negotiable based on skill) + closing bonuses (paid only when deals close)

Start: ASAP



About Us



The Milner Team is a fast-growing real estate team in Southwest Florida (Cape Coral/Fort Myers). Our content is the core of our inbound marketing: relocation videos, home tours, lifestyle content, and market updates. We’re investing into better cameras, better production, and better systems — now we want a killer editor/content manager to take our output to the next level.



This is a long-term role. We value loyalty and consistency. If you’re great, we want you with us for years.



?



The Mission



Create premium, TV-quality real estate content that:

 1. Builds trust and authority

 2. Keeps viewers watching

 3. Drives real conversations and closings



We’re not chasing random virality. We’re building a conversion-focused relocation brand that consistently generates business.



?



Your Core Responsibilities (what you own)



1) Long-Form YouTube Editing (High Priority)



Baseline expectation: ~ 5-10 long-form videos/week (varies by filming schedule)

 • Home tours (cinematic, clean pacing, thoughtful B-roll support)

 • Studio videos / educational videos (clear structure, tasteful graphics)

 • Weekly market update (edited version OR support for a live workflow + polish)



Quality standard: clean audio, strong pacing, strong story flow, polished color, tasteful music, lower-thirds where useful, and “TV-quality” feel.



2) Shorts / Reels / TikTok Repurposing

 • Pull best moments from long-form

 • Create 5–10 shorts/week depending on volume

 • Add captions, quick hooks, pattern interrupts, and clean formatting



3) Thumbnails + Title Packaging Support

 • Create high-converting thumbnails that match our brand style

 • Provide 2–3 thumbnail variations when needed

 • Support title/description packaging using our SEO/conversion-first workflow (we have templates and AI tools)



4) Scheduling / Publishing (No Confusion)



You are responsible for publishing the videos you edit:

 • Upload YouTube long + Shorts

 • Ensure correct metadata: title, description, tags, chapters when applicable

 • Coordinate with our Ops VA so tasks do not overlap:

 • You publish YouTube content (long + Shorts) and deliver social-ready files

 • Ops VA posts across IG/FB/TikTok + handles DMs/comments + lead routing



(If you’re a unicorn who can do everything, great — but we still keep responsibilities clearly separated.)



5) Content System Support (Optional Upside)



Nice-to-have, not required:

 • Basic blog post drafts from video transcripts (AI-assisted)

 • Simple website/WordPress edits or landing page assistance (Brayden leads marketing)



?



What You Are NOT Responsible For

 • Running paid ads (Brayden does ads)

 • Filming (Brayden is on camera; we may add local videographer later)

 • Being an ISA or handling lead follow-up (Ops VA handles CRM/lead ops)

 • Writing complex scripts from scratch (Brayden + AI handle scripting; you can assist)



?



What “Great” Looks Like (Performance Expectations)

 • Videos are consistently delivered on schedule

 • Editing quality improves retention and watchability

 • Thumbnails look premium and compete with top channels in our niche

 • Shorts consistently look clean and native to platform

 • You’re proactive: you spot ways to improve workflow, pacing, packaging, and consistency



?



Skills & Requirements



Must-have:

 • Strong editing skills (Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or DaVinci Resolve)

 • Strong audio cleanup and pacing instincts

 • Real examples of long-form YouTube work (portfolio required)

 • Understanding of YouTube packaging (thumbnail + title + hook + retention)

 • Able to follow brand templates and SOPs consistently



Nice-to-have:

 • Motion graphics / lower thirds (tasteful, not cheesy)

 • Color grading

 • Thumbnail design experience in Photoshop/Canva

 • YouTube channel growth experience (retention + CTR improvements)

 • Real estate content experience (a plus, not required)



?



Compensation (Salary + Closing Bonuses)



We prefer a full-time salary or flat weekly pay based on skill and output. We’ll set compensation after reviewing your portfolio and turnaround speed.



Closing Bonus (clean + grounded)



We pay bonuses only when a deal closes that is clearly attributed to our content funnels.

 • $150 per closed house transaction attributed to content funnel/link tracking

 • $75 per closed lot transaction attributed to content funnel/link tracking

 • Paid at closing only. If it doesn’t close, no bonus.



How attribution works (simple):

 • Leads who come in through your tracked links/UTM pages or are logged as “Content/YouTube/Organic” in CRM.

 • This is not based on views. It’s based on closed business.



?



Our Content Pillars (What You’ll Be Editing)

 1. Market updates (weekly)

 2. Home tours (weekly)

 3. Lifestyle/community tours (weekly/bi-weekly)

 4. Relocation/education videos (evergreen)



We want everything to look like it belongs on TV — clean, premium, and consistent.



?



Application Instructions (Required)



To apply, please send:

 1. Your portfolio (2–4 examples of long-form YouTube edits + 2–4 shorts)

 2. Your editing software (Premiere/Resolve/etc.) and weekly capacity

 3. Your preferred compensation structure (weekly salary range)

 4. Answer these questions:



 • How long does it take you to edit a 15–25 minute home tour to premium quality?

 • Can you create thumbnails? If yes, show 2 examples.

 • Are you comfortable turning long-form into shorts quickly and consistently?



Paid Test (required)



Final candidates will receive a short paid test:

 • 1 long-form segment + request for 2 shorts + 1 thumbnail concept



?



Why This Role Is Different



We’re building a real business, not a vanity channel. If you want to be part of a team where content directly drives closings (and you can share in the upside), this is for you.



Long-term, this role can grow into a Content Director position managing additional editors and a bigger content pipeline.

title: Executive Assistant / Chief of Staff (Virtual)
description:
We are seeking an exceptionally organized and proactive Executive Assistant / Virtual Chief of Staff to support our leadership team. This is not your typical EA role — we need someone who can think strategically, operate with a high degree of autonomy, and keep the entire organization running like clockwork. If you thrive on structure, love building systems, and can juggle multiple high-priority initiatives without dropping the ball, this role was made for you.



ABOUT THE ROLE:

You will serve as the right hand to the executive team, acting as a force multiplier across the business. You will own our organizational systems, manage workflows, keep projects on track, and ensure nothing falls through the cracks. You will also support M&A-related activity, so familiarity with that process is important. Your job is to make our leadership team more effective by removing friction, increasing visibility, and driving accountability across the organization.



RESPONSIBILITIES:

- Own and manage the company's ClickUp workspace — build and maintain task structures, project boards, templates, SOPs, and workflows

- Ensure all tea
mbers are using ClickUp correctly and that tasks, deadlines, and priorities are clearly tracked and up to date

- Serve as the organizational backbone of the team — track open items, follow up on action items, and hold people accountable to deadlines

- Manage the executive's calendar, schedule meetings, and coordinate across time zones

- Prepare agendas, take detailed meeting notes, and distribute action items with clear ownership and deadlines

- Support M&A activities including organizing deal flow documentation, tracking due diligence checklists, coordinating with advisors and stakeholders, and maintaining deal timelines

- Create and maintain SOPs, process documentation, and internal wikis

- Draft, proofread, and send communications on behalf of leadership as needed

- Identify operational gaps and proactively suggest improvements to systems and processes

- Manage special projects from inception to completion, keeping leadership informed at every stage

- Coordinate across departments to ensure cross-functional projects stay on schedule

- Handle sensitive and confidential information with the utmost discretion



REQUIREMENTS:

- Proven experience as an Executive Assistant, Chief of Staff, or in a high-level operations/project management role

- Expert-level proficiency in ClickUp — you should know it inside and out (automation, dashboards, templates, views, etc.)

- Strong understanding of M&A processes — deal sourcing, due diligence, LOIs, closing timelines, or similar experience

- Exceptional organizational skills — you take pride in having everything documented, tracked, and structured

- Ability to manage multiple high-priority projects simultaneously without losing attention to detail

- Strong critical thinking skills — you don't just complete tasks, you think about why they matter and what comes next

- Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

- High level of discretion and professionalism when handling confidential matters

- Self-starter who can work independently with minimal supervision in a remote environment

- Reliable high-speed internet connection and a quiet, professional workspace

- Proficiency with Google Workspace, Microsoft Office, and other productivity tools

- Experience with project management, Slack, Zoom, or similar tools is a plus



WHAT WE OFFER:

- Competitive salary based on experience

- A high-impact, high-visibility role where your work truly matters

- Long-term, stable remote opportunity with a growing company

- Direct access to and mentorship from senior leadership

- A fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment where no two days are the same



If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please submit your resume, a brief description of why you believe you would be a good fit for this role, and a short video of you telling us why you are the best and what sets you apart from the others. You must submit a video and you must have the subject line of your application include the phrase: "Your problems are over".

title: Sales & Marketing Associate
description:
The Perfect Sales Job!



We are looking for the top 10% of sales performers in the world. If you have a strong history of sales success, this might be the dream role for you.



What We Offer



Starting with a great base salary, this job offers incredible earning potential:

* Base Salary: $750 USD per month

* Commissions: 5% on all new sales

* Quality Leads: 100% work-from-home with preset and pre-qualified appointments (No cold calling!)



Plus, after your first year, you unlock:

* Health and dental program

* Performance bonuses

*Retirement program



About the Role & Training



Like we said, this is the world's perfect sales job! This role was designed by our CEO, Steven Lloyd, author of four books on selling, internet, and AI technology.



You will not be left to figure things out on your own—you will be personally trained by one of the best salespeople in the world.



Minimum Requirements



Please review these carefully. We are highly selective, and there are no exceptions to these requirements:



* Location: You must be based in the Philippines. Our entire team is built and managed in the Philippines.

* Language Skills: You must be able to speak, write, and communicate in near-perfect American English. A very slight Filipino accent is acceptable. (If you are from Cebu or have extensive BPO phone experience, you might be a perfect candidate!)

* Experience: At least 1 year of experience working US East Coast hours (8:00 AM to 5:00 PM EST / 9:00 PM to 5:00 AM PHT).

* Workspace: A private home working environment completely free of background noise (no barking dogs, crowing roosters, etc.). No exceptions!

Equipment: ? 

-- A good working computer (at least 2.5 GHz clock speed, 8 GB of RAM, and an SSD for storage).

-- A high-quality USB headset with a noise-canceling microphone (or the willingness to purchase one).

* Tech Skills: Familiarity with online digital backup. It is easy to learn, and we will train you if necessary, but you must be trainable!

* Tea
etings: Must be able to attend a weekly Zoom tea
eting every Friday at 8:30 AM PHT. Working from home is fun but can be lonely; this ensures you remain independent while feeling like an important part of our international team.



???? Earning Potential & Expectations



This is honestly the perfect sales job from home. An above-average salesperson can and will generate $50,000 USD (approx.  2.9 million PHP) a year. Take this seriously!



Note: Please do not assume that just because you've worked the phones for a BPO, you are automatically a salesperson. We are truly looking for top-notch sales professionals. If you make the cut, you will be treated like royalty in our company!



HOW TO APPLY (Crucial Step)



To qualify for a personal interview, you MUST put the following exact sentence in the first line of your application:



"I understand and agree with all of the requirements and I honestly believe that I qualify for an interview."



Any application received that does not contain this in the very first line will be immediately discarded and not read. Please do not waste our time, and we will not waste yours!

title: Amazon PPC Manager
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon PPC Manager

Reports To: CEO / Amazon Optimization Manager

Work Hours: Philippines Daytime Work Hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go-getters, and people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies, continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.



At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family—both internally and customer-facing. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!



That’s where you come in as our next Amazon PPC Manager.



Role Purpose

The Amazon PPC Manager owns the performance of all paid advertising on Amazon across our catalog. This person leads the strategy, execution, and optimization of all Sponsored Product, Sponsored Brand, and Sponsored Display campaigns to drive discoverability, revenue growth, and profitable scaling.



You will leverage Scale Insights daily—using advanced features like automation flows, keyword scoring, search term mining, and campaign-level rule logic—to drive high-impact decisions. Your ability to move beyond manual optimization and harness automation for scale is critical to success in this role.



What Success Looks Like

You consistently drive performance improvements using both manual and automated techniques, with Scale Insights as your core control panel. You own automation flows that intelligently adjust bids, pause underperforming targets, surface search term goldmines, and scale winners. You don’t just use Scale Insights—you master it.



You maintain a proactive and adaptive PPC strategy aligned with the catalog lifecycle, launch timing, and seasonality. Through frequent reporting, experimentation, and coordination with SEO, creative, and ops, you ensure campaigns support profitable, long-term growth.



Primary Objectives

Maximize profitable growth through advanced automation using Scale Insights

Own and optimize campaign architecture to drive ROI across all product stages

Partner cross-functionally for ad-aligned launches, creatives, and keyword strategy

Test, measure, and iterate to continuously improve CTR, CVR, and ROAS



Regular Work Activities

Monitor and refine SP/SB/SD campaigns daily through Scale Insights dashboards

Execute bid adjustments, search term mining, negative pruning

Build and optimize automation rules and flows in Scale Insights

Audit underperforming ad groups and apply automated corrective logic

Set up rule-based triggers for seasonal budget shifts and event-based bidding

Conduct A/B testing for headlines, images, placements

Weekly reporting with commentary using Scale Insights and custom dashboards

Work with SEO to align ad keyword targeting with organic ranking efforts

Collaborate with creative to ensure ad assets match campaign goals

Track budget utilization and reallocate funds based on real-time data

Maintain documentation and SOPs for all Scale Insights workflows

Guide PPC Assistants on implementing and QA’ing automation rules

Troubleshoot disapproved or underperforming ads

Flag inventory and pricing concerns affecting campaign viability

Maintain performance calendars for launches, promos, seasonality



Key Skills

Advanced knowledge of Scale Insights (automation, keyword scoring, flows)

Deep understanding of Amazon Ads (SP, SB, SD)

Strategic and analytical mindset with strong Excel/Google Sheets skills

Mastery in keyword match types, campaign structure, and budget management

Proven record of improving CTR, CVR, and ROAS

Excellent reporting and data storytelling skills

Detail-oriented with strong project tracking ability

Comfortable owning results, fixing issues, and moving fast

Strong communication across SEO, creative, and leadership teams

Passionate about learning and applying new ad techniques



People Contacts and Interactions

title: Senior Video Editor — Andrew Fraser
description:
Hi, I'm Andrew. I run a YouTube channel 
 making documentaries about culture, and the messy reality of travel in Asia. We just crossed 400K subscribers and we're scaling up. I need a senior editor who can own projects from start to finish, mentor younger editors, and help shape how this channel looks and feels as we grow.



You've cut docs or videos with story before. You know how to find the story in chaotic footage without someone holding your hand. You can build narrative, pace it right, and make people feel something. You also know how to run a technical pipeline and teach others to see what you see.



**What you'd do:**

- Lead editing on short- and mid-form docs (10–40 min) from assembly through picture lock

- Build narrative, pacing, emotional beats. I trust you to run with it.

- Own colour, audio, deliverables

- Mentor junior editors. Teach them to see, not just fix their work.

- Work with me on story development and series planning



**What I need:**

- Body of work proving you can find the story in messy footage

- 5+ years cutting docs, travel, or food. You know this world.

- Experience managing and elevating junior editors

- Self-directed. I give you footage and a deadline, you deliver better than I hoped.

- Based in Vietnam or Asia time zones



**Nice to have:** DaVinci Resolve experience, after effects skills Multicam experience.



**To apply:** Send a video you edited that you are proud of, your reel if you have one and  two sentences about why this kind of storytelling matters to you.

title: Digital Editorial Assistant
description:
I am a professional writer who publishes regularly for a major digital publication. I am looking for a highly detail-oriented Digital Editorial Assistant to help with consistent, process-driven tasks that support my publishing workflow.

This is not a writing role. You will not be creating original articles or contributing editorial voice. Instead, you will help take repetitive, mechanical tasks off my plate so I can focus on research and writing.

Core Responsibilities

• Review completed articles and apply a detailed formatting rule system (which I will provide).

• Correct stylistic and formatting elements such as italics usage, punctuation rules, capitalization, abbreviations (e.g., U.S.), numeral formatting, headline structure, and other publication-specific standards.

• Ensure consistency and precision across every article.

• Create SEO support materials based on provided guidelines (e.g., headline suggestions, summaries, key phrases).

• Insert internal hyperlinks within articles according to provided direction.

• Review AI-assisted outputs and confirm accuracy before returning final drafts.

I currently use AI tools as part of my workflow. You are welcome to use AI tools to help complete tasks efficiently, but the final responsibility for accuracy, formatting compliance, and quality control will be yours.

What This Role Is Not

• You will not be writing opinion pieces or developing story ideas.

• You will not be responsible for publishing decisions.

• You will not need access to publishing platforms.

This role is focused on structure, compliance, formatting precision, and process execution.

Ideal Candidate

• Extremely detail-oriented and comfortable working from a strict style guide.

• Strong written English skills and excellent grammar knowledge.

• Comfortable following rule systems without improvising or altering tone.

• Reliable, organized, and responsive.

• Comfortable using Google Docs and collaborating in shared documents.

• Familiarity with digital publishing or SEO basics is a plus but not required.

The right person for this role enjoys making things clean, correct, and consistent. Small details matter here.

Workflow & Communication

Work will be assigned through Google Docs. I may tag you when new articles are ready for formatting. Turnaround time will typically be within a few hours to one day, depending on volume.

Hours will start between 5–10 hours per week, with potential for additional work over time. Schedule is flexible, but availability and responsiveness are important.

Long-Term Potential

This role may expand to include additional research, digital organization, and publishing support tasks as we build trust and establish workflow rhythm.

If you are organized, precise, comfortable working with structured guidelines, and interested in supporting a high-output digital publishing workflow, I would love to hear from you.

Please include in your application:

A brief description of your experience with formatting or editorial support.

Confirmation that you are comfortable working from detailed style rules.

Your weekly availability and expected hourly rate.

title: Medical Billing Virtual Assistant
description:
We are a growing homecare agency seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Medical Billing Virtual Assistant to support our billing operations. This is a remote, full-time position where you will play a key role in ensuring accurate and timely billing for our home health and personal care services.



RESPONSIBILITIES:

- Manage and process claims within HHAeXchange and other homecare billing platforms

- Submit claims to Medicaid, Medicare, and managed care organizations (MCOs)

- Verify patient/client authorizations and ensure visit data in HHAeXchange is accurate before billing

- Follow up on unpaid, denied, or rejected claims and resubmit with corrections as needed

- Review Electronic Remittance Advices (ERAs) and post payments and adjustments to accounts

- Reconcile visit notes and EVV (Electronic Visit Verification) data to ensure compliance prior to billing

- Identify and resolve EVV exceptions or discrepancies in a timely manner

- Monitor authorization utilization and flag over/under-utilization to the appropriate tea
mbers

- Coordinate with schedulers, coordinators, and clinical staff to obtain missing documentation

- Maintain organized and accurate billing records in compliance with HIPAA regulations

- Generate billing reports and provide regular status updates to management

- Stay current on Medicaid billing requirements and homecare payer guidelines



REQUIREMENTS:

- Minimum 2 years of experience in medical billing, preferably in homecare, home health, or personal care services

- Hands-on experience with HHAeXchange is strongly preferred

- Familiarity with EVV compliance requirements and Medicaid/MCO billing processes

- Knowledge of CPT, HCPCS, and revenue codes used in homecare billing

- Experience working with Medicaid, Medicare, and managed long-term care (MLTC) payers

- Strong attention to detail, especially with authorization tracking and claim accuracy

- Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

- Ability to work independently, stay organized, and meet deadlines

- Reliable high-speed internet connection and a quiet, professional work environment

- Proficiency with Google Workspace and/or Microsoft Office



WHAT WE OFFER:

- Competitive salary based on experience

- Stable, long-term remote work opportunity with a growing homecare company

- Supportive team environment with clear communication and expectations

- Opportunity to grow with the company



If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please submit your resume, a brief description of why you believe you would be a good fit for this role, and a short video of you telling us why you are the best and what sets you apart from the others. You must submit a video and you must have the subject line of your application include the phrase: "Your problems are over".

title: Ecom Performance Video Editor | High-Growth | Long-Term
description:
## Role Overview



The purpose of the Video Editor role at Ivy Ecommerce is to transform creative briefs into high-performing video ads that drive conversions at scale.



This is not just a technical editing role.



Our Video Editors are an integral part of the marketing engine. Your job is to understand the psychology, messaging, and strategy behind each ad concept, and bring it to life through sharp editing, pacing, storytelling, and attention to detail.



As a Video Editor, you are responsible for the execution and final polish of our video ads. The success of our marketing team depends on your ability to:



- Understand each creative brief from a performance/direct-response marketing lens

- Assemble visuals, hooks, captions, and pacing in a way that maximizes conversions

- Enhance the core marketing message through smart creative decisions



You understand that small details can be the difference between an ad that gets scaled to millions in spend and one that dies after testing.



Your role is to work closely with our Creative Strategists, actively learn what makes ads win or lose, and help us consistently produce winning ads month over month across our brand portfolio.





### Primary Responsibilities



- Edit and deliver ~10 ad briefs per week

- Collaborate closely with Creative Strategists to ensure each ad concept is executed correctly

- Implement feedback from the creative team and performance data to improve iterations

- Learn and internalize our ad strategy frameworks to understand what makes creatives “win” or “lose”

- Analyze your own creatives to identify what’s working, what isn’t, and how to improve

- Upload and organize final assets into the correct folders and formats for each platform





## Qualifications



### Direct Experience



- 1+ year experience editing eCommerce / performance marketing ads

- Experience working within a team environment and understanding roles in a creative workflow





### Character Traits We Look For



- Extremely high attention to detail – you care about the small things because you know they matter

- Creative + marketing-minded – you’re not just an editor, you’re curious about why ads perform

- Strong visual communicator and storyteller

- High curiosity and a desire to continuously improve your creative and marketing skills

- Willingness to do the “boring but important” work consistently at a high standard

- Clear communicator who collaborates well with a team

- Time-efficient, but willing to put in extra effort when quality demands it

- Hungry, motivated, and growth-oriented – you want to get better, take on more responsibility, and level up your career

- to make sure you are still reading, type “BLUE” in your response title.

- Coachable and open to feedback

- Not a clock-in, clock-out mindset — you care about results and impact







### This Role Is NOT for You If:



- You only want to execute tasks without understanding the marketing behind them

- You’re not interested in learning performance marketing or creative strategy

- You dislike feedback or fast-paced environments

- You’re disorganized or unreliable

- You prefer working solo and don’t enjoy team collaboration

- You’re not motivated to grow your skills and career over time







### Growth & Upside



At Ivy Ecommerce, we invest in people who perform and show initiative. This role has real upside for those who take ownership:



- Opportunity to grow into a Creative Strategist / Creative Lead role over time

- Increased responsibility across multiple brands in our portfolio

- Performance-based bonuses tied to ad spend (no cap)

- Long-term growth path into higher-level marketing and creative leadership roles



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants to build a career in performance marketing, creative & be part of building cool ecom brands, not just edit videos.







## ???? How to Apply



To be considered, please reply with:



- A short overview of yourself

- Your CV / Resume with your past work experience

- Your eCommerce video editing portfolio

- Your
 address + WhatsApp number



Then answer the questions below in detail:



1. What about this role excites you most?

2. Why do you believe you’re a strong fit for this role?

   

    



Applications that do not follow these instructions or provide detailed answers will not be reviewed.

Role Overview



The Partner Support Specialist will be the first line of defense on chat and
, helping our partners resolve technical and administrative issues, ensuring smooth communication, and troubleshooting challenges. You will manage incoming chats and
s, track tickets, and ensure partner needs are met efficiently. The role also involves vendor outreach, administrative tasks, and product setup for new clients. Over time, you will have opportunities to take on more advanced roles as you grow with the company.



Key Responsibilities



* First-Contact Resolution: Troubleshoot and resolve partner inquiries, ensuring a 70% first-contact resolution rate for partner inquiries. [Within the first 3 months of joining].

* Response Time: Respond to partner inquiries within 5 minutes for chats and 3 hours for
s during your regular business hours. [Ongoing].

* Ticket Management: Track and manage support tickets using a ticketing system (e.g., Zendesk, Freshdesk) to ensure all issues are resolved promptly. Close 90% of inquiries within 48 hours.

* Client Onboarding: Assist with the initial setup of our systems when a new client onboards to ensure successful data syncs with a 90% success rate.

* Vendor Outreach & Admin: Provide support with vendor outreach and administrative tasks, as needed. [Ongoing].

* Collaboration: Work with the Partner Success and Product teams to communicate findings from partner interactions and ensure partner needs are addressed. [Ongoing].



Key Outcomes



* Achieve a 4.5/5 satisfaction rating or higher for partner support interactions (chat/email).

* Close 90% of support tickets within 48 hours of receiving inquiries.

* Ensure 90% success rate for assigned client onboarding tasks.



Must-Have Qualifications



* 2+ years of experience in technical support, software support, or a related role.

* Strong technical aptitude and problem-solving skills, with the ability to learn and troubleshoot software-related issues.

* Experience with ticket tracking systems (e.g., Zendesk, Freshdesk) and a proven ability to resolve customer issues in a timely manner.

* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present technical information clearly to non-technical users.

* Strong attention to detail and excellent time management skills.

* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.



Preferred Qualifications



* Experience in customer support for SaaS platforms or other software solutions.

* Experience in vendor outreach or administrative tasks.

* Background in the education or nonprofit sectors is a plus.



Logistical Notes



This is a 100% remote role with a flexible start date, but availability during US Pacific Time business hours (8 am - 5 pm) is required.



Edstruments does not and will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender orientation, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status in any of its hiring decisions or other activities.



Why Edstruments?



* Mission-Driven Work: Work with a team passionate about improving financial processes for K12 and nonprofit organizations.

* Growth Opportunities: We offer potential for career advancement and development as the company scales.

* Remote Flexibility: Join a 100% remote team with a flexible start date.

title: Copywriter
description:
Brand3 is a US-based marketing agency.

We’re looking for a detail-oriented and creative Copywriter to join our remote team and write for brands across diverse industries. You will be essential in delivering our promise of moving brands to clarity, crafting persuasive copy that cuts through the noise and connects meaningfully with our clients' audiences.

Responsibilities

Collaboration: Work closely with our creative team and content strategist to understand our clients’ core messages and values; join brainstorming sessions to understand project objectives and contribute creative ideas.

Content Creation: Draft and revise compelling copy for various marketing materials, including blog posts, web content, social media, and promotional campaigns.

Research: Stay informed about industry trends to create relevant, innovative, and original content.

Brand Alignment: Ensure all written content aligns with Brand3’s clarity-first philosophy and adheres to the brand voice of our clients.

Content Optimization: Basic use of SEO principles to optimize articles for search engine rankings.

Feedback Implementation: Revise and improve content based on feedback from team members and clients to ensure clarity and effectiveness.

Training Participation: Engage in various training sessions with our content strategist to expand knowledge on writing diverse copy types and using different content tools.

Requirements

Education: Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Marketing, Communications, or a related field.

Writing Samples: Ability to provide writing samples, whether from coursework, personal projects, or other experiences.

Attention to Detail: Excellent writing, grammar, and proofreading skills

Technical Familiarity: A basic understanding of brand strategy and SEO principles is a plus but not mandatory. 

Research Skills: Eagerness to learn about diverse industries, target audiences, and emerging trends.

Collaborative Spirit: Willingness to work in a team environment and learn from various team members.

Communication: Openness to feedback and strong interpersonal communication skills.

Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing client needs, feedback, and evolving project requirements.

Time Management: Organizational skills to manage multiple tasks and adhere to deadlines.

Continuous Learning: A curious mindset, eager to stay updated with industry trends and best practices.

title: Milner Team Manager (Real Estate Operations VA + ISA Support)
description:
Job Title: Milner Team Manager (Real Estate Operations VA + ISA Support)

Company: The Milner Team at Florida Future Realty (Southwest Florida)

Location: Remote (Philippines preferred)

Hours: Part-time to start (20–25 hrs/week) with the option to grow to full-time

Work Hours: Ideally you will work 7-3 or 8-4 EST however we're flexible.

Pay: $5/hour base + closing bonuses (paid only when deals close)



?



About Us



We’re a fast-growing real estate team in Southwest Florida (Cape Coral / Fort Myers area). We generate a steady flow of leads through marketing and content, and we have multiple agents working those leads. We’re looking for our first long-term “all-in-one” Operations VA to help run the day-to-day execution so nothing slips through the cracks.



This is a long-term position. We prefer someone who wants stability, growth, and to become a key part of the team.



?



What You’ll Be Responsible For (In Priority Order)



1) ISA Work (Calling + Reactivation + Outbound)

 • Reactivate old leads (the “pond”) by calling/texting

 • Help with inbound follow-up if agents can’t reach someone

 • Make outbound calls to expired/cancelled/withdrawn lists when assigned

 • Light qualification + set next step (you do NOT negotiate or discuss contract terms)



Important routing rule:

 • Seller leads you generate go directly to Brayden (team lead).

 • Buyer leads go through the normal team routing system.



Goal: Consistent outbound activity that contributes to closed deals.



?



2) Transaction & Listing Coordination (Checklist-Based)

 • Track active listings and pending contracts using a simple checklist

 • Monitor deadlines (inspection, financing, appraisal, closing, signatures)

 • Send weekly seller/buyer update messages (templates provided)

 • Chase missing documents and signatures

 • Escalate urgent issues to the team lead immediately



Goal: No missed deadlines. Clients get weekly updates without reminders.



?



3) Lead Management + CRM Organization (Lofty CRM)

 • Monitor new leads and make sure they are tagged and assigned correctly

 • Ensure agents are following up (and flag problems to the team lead)

 • Keep CRM clean: notes, stages, tags, dedupe, correct contact info

 • If a lead is not being worked, you take over follow-up or reroute



Goal: Zero “orphan leads.” Everything is assigned and being worked.



?



4) Content Posting + Social Media Inbox Management



(You are NOT editing videos or planning content topics — we provide the “Build Pack”)

 • Schedule/post videos across: YouTube (long + Shorts), Instagram,
, TikTok

 • Use provided captions/titles/hashtags/CTAs (templates provided)

 • Check DMs/comments 2–3x/day during your shift

 • Respond professionally and capture leads into CRM



Goal: Posts go out on schedule and DMs turn into leads.



?



5) Team Support (Help Desk)

 • Help agents with basic CRM questions and process questions

 • Assist with small operational tasks (vendor scheduling, open house support) when needed

 • You are not an agent’s personal assistant — core tasks come first



?



Tools You’ll Use

 • Lofty CRM (or similar CRM experience is fine)

 • Google Drive/Docs/Sheets

 • Meta/Instagram, TikTok, YouTube

 • Dialer/tools for calling (we will provide access)



?



Pay & Bonus Structure (Closing-Only)



Base pay: $5/hour



Closing bonuses (paid only when deals close):

 • $75 per closed house transaction you generate through ISA work 

 • $50 per closed lot transaction you generate through ISA work

 • $75 per closed house transaction you support through transaction coordination/ops

 • $25 per closed lot transaction you support through transaction coordination/ops



No bonuses are paid for appointments. Bonuses are paid only when a deal closes. Max bonus on a deal is $150 (house transaction that you generated through isa work and supported through transaction coordination)

?



Requirements (Must-Have)

 • Real estate VA / ISA / TC / operations experience (any combination)

 • Comfortable making outbound calls (English) and following up consistently

 • Very organized and detail-oriented (you catch what others miss)

 • Able to work overlap hours with my schedule  (12PM–8PM EST need a few hour overlap)

 • Reliable internet + quiet workspace

 • Quick learner, proactive, consistent



Nice to Have

 • Canva/basic graphic skills

 • Experience with Lofty or similar CRMs (Follow Up Boss, Chime, KVCore, BoomTown)

 • Experience supporting a real estate team with multiple agents



Why This Is a Great Long-Term Role



If you like being the “operator” who keeps everything clean, consistent, and moving — and you enjoy helping a business scale — you’ll love this role. We have systems, templates, and steady lead flow. We’re looking for someone who wants to grow with us for years.

description:
Rate - 20,000 - 24,000 Depending on Skills and Experience

Day Shift (Australian) 



PLEASE READ THROUGH THE WHOLE POST 



We are seeking a versatile, proactive Virtual Assistant to support a diverse business portfolio spanning the Agriculture, Heavy Transport, and Health & Fitness sectors. - Financial & Admin Support: Handle Xero invoicing and reconciliation for a logistics/trucking operation (SOPs and documented processes provided).

The Perks

Who You Are

title: SHOPIFY DROPSHIPPING EXPERT
description:
Shopify Dropshipping Specialist



We are a fast-growing e-commerce and marketing company that specializes in building, launching, and scaling profitable Shopify dropshipping stores for our clients. Our mission is to identify winning products, create high-converting storefronts, and drive scalable traffic through paid advertising and automated fulfillment systems.



We are seeking a Shopify Dropshipping Expert who can manage the full lifecycle of dropshipping stores—from product research and supplier sourcing to paid ads management and scaling performance.



Responsibilities

Product Research & Supplier Sourcing



Identify trending, high-demand products suitable for Shopify dropshipping.



Source and vet reliable suppliers (AliExpress, private agents, wholesalers, etc.).



Ensure competitive pricing, shipping times, and product quality standards.



Shopify Store Setup & Product Listings



Build and optimize Shopify product pages with persuasive copy, pricing, and visuals.



Implement upsells, bundles, and conversion-focused layouts.



Manage product imports, variants, and inventory settings.



Paid Ads Management (Meta / TikTok / Google)



Launch, manage, and optimize paid ad campaigns for dropshipping products.



Test creatives, audiences, hooks, and offers to find winning combinations.



Scale profitable campaigns while maintaining target CPA/ROAS.



Monitor ad performance and adjust budgets and targeting accordingly.



Automation & Fulfillment Management



Implement and manage dropshipping apps and integrations (DSers, AutoDS, CJ, etc.).



Ensure seamless order routing, tracking updates, and supplier sync.



Oversee order fulfillment flow and resolve supplier or shipping issues.



Store Scaling & Conversion Optimization



Optimize product pages, offers, and pricing to maximize conversion rate and AOV.



Test bundles, upsells, landing pages, and promotions.



Identify winning products and scale across stores.



Performance Monitoring & Reporting



Track KPIs including revenue, CPA, ROAS, conversion rate, and margins.



Provide weekly reports and growth recommendations.



Monitor product performance and discontinue underperformers.



Collaboration



Work with creative teams to produce ad creatives and UGC-style content.



Align product and advertising strategy across campaigns and stores.



Support internal teams and clients with Shopify dropshipping best practices.



Requirements



Proven experience running Shopify dropshipping stores and paid ads.



Strong product research and supplier sourcing experience.



Experience managing Meta, TikTok, or Google e-commerce ad campaigns.



Familiarity with dropshipping tools (DSers, AutoDS, Zendrop, CJdropshipping, etc.).



Understanding of conversion optimization and funnel performance.



Ability to analyze store and ad metrics to scale winning products.



Strong organization and communication skills.

title: Appointment Setter
description:
We are looking for a highly motivated and fluent English-speaking Appointment Setter based in the Philippines to support our final expense life insurance agents. Your primary responsibility is to call qualified leads, follow our proven script, and set appointments for our licensed agents.



Responsibilities:

Call warm leads who have requested information online about final expense life insurance.



Use our pre-written script to engage prospects and set appointments for licensed agents.



Update call outcomes and appointment details in our CRM or tracking spreadsheet.



Maintain professionalism and empathy while speaking with senior-aged prospects (typically 55+).



Meet daily and weekly appointment-setting quotas.



Requirements:

Must speak fluent, neutral, and clear English – no strong accent.



Prior experience in appointment setting or telemarketing (preferably in insurance or financial services).



Quiet home office setup with reliable internet and noise-canceling headset.



Must be available during U.S. business hours (Eastern or Central Time preferred).



Comfortable following a script and handling mild objections.





___________________________-





To be considered for an interview you must submit a recording saying this script:





"Hi, is this [First Name]? This is [Your Name], just following up on your request for final expense insurance info. You had mentioned your favorite color was [Color] — does that ring a bell? You were looking for coverage to help with funeral costs and leave something behind. I’ve got a licensed agent ready to go over your options — it only takes 15 minutes. Does morning or afternoon work better for a quick call?"

title: Appointment Setter
description:
We are looking for a Remote Appointment Setter to contact warm leads who have not yet booked a call. Your role is to engage potential clients, answer basic questions, and schedule appointments on our Business Development Reps' (BDRs) calendars.



Responsibilities:



Call and follow up with leads who have expressed interest but haven’t scheduled a meeting.

Qualify leads and ensure they meet basic criteria.

Use CRM tools to track interactions and schedule appointments.

Maintain a professional and engaging tone to encourage conversions.

Requirements:



Prior experience in appointment setting, sales, or customer service preferred.

Strong communication skills and ability to build rapport quickly.

Self-motivated, organized, and comfortable working remotely.

Basic familiarity with CRM systems is a plus.



YOU MUST SPEAK PERFECT ENGLISH.



Please submit a recording of you speaking this script along with you application. 



"**???? Appointment Setting Script – Marketplace Launch**  



**???? Introduction:**  

**David:** "Hey, is this [Lead’s Name]?"  



**Lead:** *Yes.*  



**David:** "Hey [Lead’s Name], my name is David, and I was calling because it looks like you previously showed some interest in getting an **e-commerce store set up and managed for you**. Does that ring a bell?"  



**???? If YES:**  

**David:** "Great! My job here is simple—I’m just here to get you scheduled with one of our **Business Development Reps** who will go over everything we have to offer and see if it’s a good fit for you.  



Would **tomorrow or the day after** work better for you?"  



(*Wait for response*)  



"Awesome! Do you prefer **morning or afternoon?**"  



(*Confirm time and lock in appointment on the BDR’s calendar*)  



**???? Closing:**  

"Perfect, I’ve got you scheduled for [Date & Time] with [BDR’s Name]. You’ll receive a confirmation shortly. Does that sound good?"  



(*If Yes*)  

"Great! We’ll see you then—have a great day!"  



**???? If NO (They don’t remember or aren’t sure):**  

**David:** "No worries! We help people start and manage **profitable e-commerce businesses** without all the heavy lifting. You had previously checked us out, so I just wanted to see if you’d still be interested in learning more."  



(*If still interested, proceed to scheduling. If not, thank them for their time.*)  



???? **Goal:** Always **lock in a date & time** before ending the call!"

title: Administrative/Executive Assistant
description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Administrative/Executive Assistant to support our executive team and contribute to the smooth running of our business operations. The ideal candidate will have exceptional communication skills, a high degree of professionalism, and the ability to multitask effectively in a fast-paced environment.



Key Responsibilities

Executive Support: Provide administrative support to the executive team, including managing schedules, coordinating meetings, and organizing travel arrangements.

Calendar Management: Maintain and coordinate multiple executives’ calendars, ensuring meetings and appointments are scheduled efficiently.

Communication: Act as a point of contact between executives, employees, clients, and external partners, managing and prioritizing communication.

Documentation: Prepare, proofread, and edit documents, reports, presentations, and correspondence.

Meeting Coordination: Schedule and organize meetings, including preparing agendas, taking meeting minutes, and following up on action items.

Travel Arrangements: Organize and book travel accommodations, itineraries, and expense reporting for executives.

Project Assistance: Support ongoing projects by conducting research, compiling data, and ensuring timely completion of tasks.

Confidentiality: Handle sensitive information with the utmost discretion and confidentiality.

Task Management: Prioritize and manage multiple tasks and projects, meeting deadlines and maintaining high-quality work standards.



Qualifications and Skills

Experience: Minimum of 3 years of experience as an Administrative or Executive Assistant, or in a similar role.

Education: Bachelor’s degree in business administration, communications, or a related field preferred.

Technical Skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and familiarity with tools like Google Workspace, Slack, and project management software (e.g., Trello, Asana).

Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

Organization: Strong organizational skills with a keen attention to detail.

Problem-Solving: Ability to anticipate needs, think critically, and offer solutions proactively.

Professionalism: High level of integrity and the ability to handle confidential information appropriately.

Flexibility: Adaptable and able to work in a fast-paced environment with shifting priorities.

title: Senior Cloud Accountant (Direct Hire / Work from Home)
description:
Join the Team as a Senior  Cloud Accountant at Bean Ninjas USA!

Philippine CPA license highly preferred.



Bean Ninjas USA is on the lookout for enthusiastic and skilled professionals to become part of our expanding team. If you're passionate about cloud accounting and meet the qualifications listed below, we’d love to connect with you!



Filipino candidate must possess the following (Please do not apply if you do not have the following):



~ 3+ years of full-time accounting experience within a BPO or similar environment.

- end-to-end bookkeeping experience including preparation of Balance Sheet and Income Statement

~ Proficient in cloud accounting software and platforms.

~ Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.

~ Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.

~ Bachelor's degree in Accounting or related field (preferred)

- Has Xero and/or QuickBooks Online experience



Qualifications for the role:



- Full-time work (Mon-Fri) for our US clients within the Philippines working hours of 8 am to 5 pm.

- We also offer flexibility on the schedule at work once you are familiar with the processes and client work.

- Excellent attention to detail and time management skills.

- Team player who would get along well with the rest of the Bean Ninjas team



Specific Responsibilities



In this role, you will look after management reporting and weekly/monthly transaction processing for a portfolio of Bean Ninjas bookkeeping clients.



Bookkeeping Service Delivery



-Uses Xero and QuickBooks Online

-Uses Xero and QBO add-ons and integrations like Hubdoc, A2X, Receipt Bank, Stripe, and Paypal.

-Responds to client queries via our online
 helpdesk software Helpscout.

-Communicates with other staff via Slack.

-You write well: concise, understandable, helpful, professional, and fast. You can build rapport with others solely through your writing.



Remote work

-You’re self-motivated and ideally, have previous experience working remotely and with little direct supervision.

-You must have an excellent internet connection.

-You know how to keep your computer and work secure and private.

-You know the joys of using two monitors (or splitting a big monitor) to do bookkeeping work.



Who are we?

Bean Ninjas is a bookkeeping and financial reporting business founded on Australia’s Gold Coast in 2015.



We specialize in eCommerce businesses and our mission is to create financial freedom through stress-free business finances for our clients.



We have over 16 Philippine tea
mbers here and we are growing!



What’s it like being part of the Bean Ninjas team?



Career development

We believe in developing our team and promoting internally. You will go through an initial 6-month training program and will then receive ongoing training and mentoring. We prepare individual staff development plans for each tea
mber.



Flexible and remote role

This is a remote role and you will have some level of flexibility in choosing your regular work hours, but must generally be online during Philippine working hours.



Benefits

We offer a variety of benefits from 13th-month pay, birthday vouchers, birthday time off, accrued leaves, and Christmas shutdown leave (where everyone does not need to log in to work for a couple of days during the Christmas shutdown which is usually 5 to 7 working days, yet these days are still paid for by the company!), 6-week maternity leave, remote social activities, and pieces of training and up to date certifications for our accountants on various accounting platforms or integrations.



Bean Ninjas is recognized as an industry leader. You will be working alongside Chartered Accountants and CPAs who have come from firms such as Ernst and Young, BDO, and Grant Thornton.



We won the Xero Australia Bookkeeping Partner of the Year Award in 2019 and the equivalent state award for Queensland in both 2017 and 2019.



Applications can be sent to 
 and include a copy of your resume. Please do not apply if you have no relevant experience or are only looking for a project-based role. Thank you!

title: Insurance Estimator / Operations Coordinator
description:
Company: Green Future Construction, Roofing & Exteriors (Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada)  

Position: Remote Virtual Assistant – Insurance Estimator / Operations Coordinator (Exterior Claims)  

Location: Remote (Philippines preferred)  

Hours: Full-time preferred (part-time considered)  

Schedule: Philippines hours OK, but must have partial overlap with Saskatchewan business hours for a daily check-in  

Pay: Please include your expected hourly rate (based on experience)  

Software Access: We provide access to Xactimate + Symbility and other tools (including AI tools like Gemini/Sintra)



About the Role

We are a roofing and exteriors company in Canada that handles exterior-only insurance claims. Most claims are hail and wind, with occasional exterior losses from tree falls, object impacts, and vehicle impacts. We do not take interior restoration claims.



We’re looking for a reliable, detail-oriented VA who can support estimating and day-to-day operations. When claim volume is lighter, you’ll help with market research and other business tasks.



Primary Responsibilities (Core Work)

Create/update exterior-only estimates in Xactimate and Symbility

Read and interpret Hover reports and use them for quantities/takeoffs

Create clear work scopes for subcontractors (roofing/exteriors)

Build material lists and
 suppliers to order materials and schedule deliveries

Help with invoicing and job admin (file organization, tracking, follow-ups)



Secondary Responsibilities (When We’re Not Busy)

Market research (competitors, lead sources, service areas, etc.)

Help keep our social media up to date (posting, organizing before/after photos, basic scheduling)

Other tasks as assigned



Strongly Preferred (Major Asset)

Hands-on experience with Xactimate and/or Symbility (exterior insurance claims)  

Ability to read and use Hover reports  

Experience writing scopes and preparing material lists for exterior trades  

Strong written English, professional
 communication, and strong organization skills  



Applicants who clearly demonstrate Xactimate/Symbility experience will be prioritized.



To Apply (Required)

Please send your resume and answer the questions below. Applications without answers may not be reviewed.



Screening Questions

1) How many years have you used Xactimate? What types of exterior claims did you estimate?  

2) How many years have you used Symbility? What types of exterior claims did you estimate?  

3) Describe how you use a Hover report to produce quantities/takeoffs.  

4) Have you handled supplements/change orders? If yes, describe one example (no private client info).  

5) What exterior trades have you written scopes for? (roofing, siding, soffit/fascia, eavestrough, etc.)  

6) Write a short professional
 to a supplier requesting a delivery date for roofing materials (use placeholders for job name/address/contact number).  

7) What hours (PH time) can you work, and what daily overlap can you provide with Saskatchewan business hours?  

8) What is your expected hourly rate?

title: Amazon FBA Seller Central Marketing Analyst / Manager / Specialist
description:
Amazon FBA Seller Central Marketing Analyst / Manager / Specialist



+4 Years Amazon Experience Required



This is a unique opportunity for an organized and entrepreneurially-minded Amazon Manager to join our team and help operate and grow startup and household name client brands. As an Amazon Manager, you will be ideating and executing growth strategies while optimizing the Amazon presence of our rapidly growing portfolio of client products and brands.



This is a full time remote role.



What you’ll be doing:



Playing an integral role in designing and building a best-in-class Amazon presence for a set of companies from our diverse brand portfolio.



Creating and continually optimizing listings, as well as troubleshooting and fixing issues as they arise.



Developing marketing strategies across our portfolio of brands, and coordinating with stakeholders as needed to execute.



Managing promotions (coupons, deals) and PPC advertising campaigns.



Analyzing Amazon data (sales, conversation rate, sessions, etc.) to determine why certain products are trending up or down and developing strategies to increase conversions and sales.



Resolving issues that come up (listing take downs, content not publishing, catalog errors, etc.) and escalating to internal stakeholders as needed.



Developing and maintaining a professional knowledge of new or emerging trends within the Amazon and online shopping space. You’ll constantly research opportunities for improvement to drive traffic and conversion growth.





Attending weekly meetings to communicate needs and resolve issues.





Your profile / Must Have:



In-depth knowledge of Amazon Seller Central and FBA processes. +4 Years experience with a track record of success.

Comprehensive understanding of Amazon and Seller Central, best practices, along with policies and guidelines. Flat file expert.



Proven experience as an Amazon Virtual Assistant or in a similar role.

Experience in Amazon detail page optimization, listing management, SEO marketing, and PPC

Excellent organizational and analytical skills, as well as a hands-on mentality.

Excellent communications and customer service skills

Excellent English (speaking and writing)

Creative thinker



Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make informed decisions. Top notch problem solving skills.



Attention to detail. Self-motivated and able to work independently.

Good with Excel, Google Sheets, and formulas

Proficient in using Google Drive for collaborative tasks.





Nice to Have



Experience with graphic design / photoshop or similar software



Experience with social media marketing



Experience with Walmart Seller Central





About us

We are a full-service agency that works with brands and manufactures to grow their sales and profit on Amazon both in the US and globally. Additionally, we own a handful of private label brands that we own and operate ourselves.

This is a remote position, and candidates from all locations are welcome to apply. We offer flexible working hours and opportunities for professional growth within our organization.



To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are interested in this position. We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Legal Assistant
description:
We are a small firm in Vancouver, Canada currently with one lawyer. We are a busy full-service firm, but most of our work is currently litigation. Our practice areas include civil litigation, contracts, construction disputes, municipal law, real estate disputes, residential tenancy, professional regulation, business disputes, strata disputes, mediation/arbitration, wills and estates, French language services (knowledge of French not required, but is an asset). We are looking to add a legal assistant to our team. Start date is between March 20 to April 1, 2026. 



Below is your general job description. However, as a small business, we need all hands on deck; this means you will help with tasks outside your job description.  



CLIENT SUPPORT & COMMUNICATION

- Serve as the first point of contact for clients via phone and
.

- Manage client intake, including initial screenings and conflict checks.

- Schedule consultations, meetings, and court appearances.

- Respond to routine client inquiries promptly and professionally.



ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT

- Manage and organize digital files using firm-approved naming conventions.

- Prepare, proofread, and format correspondence, agreements, and legal documents from templates.

- Track deadlines and maintain calendars.

- Assist with billing, time entry, and expense tracking.



SUBSTANTIVE SUPPORT

- Conducting legal research

- Summarizing documents and evidence

- Assisting in trial preparation / chambers applications 

- Managing discovery 



DOCUMENT & CASE MANAGEMENT

- Open and close client files.

- File and organize court documents and client correspondence.

- Ensure accurate data entry in case management systems.

- Maintain confidentiality in all aspects of file handling.



PRACTICE OPERATIONS

- Handle general office administration tasks (scanning, e-filing, record keeping).

- Assist with online filings (e.g., BC Online, Land Title, or court e-filing, depending on training).

- Prepare draft invoices and monitor accounts receivable.

- Provide daily or weekly status reports to the lawyer.

________________________________________

QUALIFICATIONS: 

- You will need your own computer hardware and very strong wifi  

- Prior experience as a legal assistant, executive assistant, or VA (law firm experience preferred).

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

- Strong organizational and time-management skills.

- Proficiency with Microsoft 365. 

- Familiarity with Windows 365 and practice management software (e.g., Clio) is an asset.

- Strong ability to maintain discretion and confidentiality.

- Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to work independently with minimal supervision.

________________________________________

POSITION DETAILS:

- Remote/virtual position.

- Full-time.

- 9 AM to 5 PM Pacific Time (Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada).

- No work for other employers during work hours.

- Reports directly to the lawyer.

- May report to other staff as determined



HOW TO APPLY:

Please submit a resume, cover letter (no AI/ChatGPT), writing sample (no AI/ChatGPT), and contact information for 3 references



We thank everyone who applies, and we will respond to those selected for an interview. If you are selected for an interview, here is the process: we will conduct 2 interviews and 1 assessment. We receive many job applications and must filter for serious candidates; in the title of your job application, please include the word ‘Happiness’ so we know you read this. We wish you the best in your job search.
