title: Art Director
description:
ABOUT THE JOB

Are you a strategic creative leader who can manage multiple client relationships while driving design excellence? Penji is seeking an Art Director to manage a portfolio of clients, serving as their primary creative partner and trusted advisor. In this role, you'll focus on client strategy, relationship building, and creative direction—not day-to-day project execution. You'll conduct discovery sessions, lead strategy calls, and translate client goals into actionable creative direction for Project Managers and designers. This position requires strong English communication skills (written and verbal), deep knowledge across design disciplines, and the ability to identify growth opportunities while ensuring exceptional client satisfaction. If you're a design-savvy relationship builder who thrives in a strategic role, apply to join Penji today.



ABOUT THE COMPANY

Since 2017, Penji has provided on-demand access to the top 2% of graphic designers. We're the leader in graphic design subscription services and have been recognized by Inc. Magazine as one of the fastest-growing companies.  Beyond our business success, we're a community-conscious startup dedicated to supporting nonprofits and those helping others. Graphic design is what we do. Being a responsible employer and supporting our communities is who we aim to be. Join us on our mission to leave a positive footprint.



RESPONSIBILITIES:

? Client Portfolio Management: Manage assigned clients by researching their branding, understanding their business goals, and maintaining consistent communication to ensure satisfaction.

? Strategic Communication:
 and message clients regularly following communication guidelines, proactively addressing needs and gathering feedback.

? Onboarding Leadership: Conduct onboarding calls with new clients alongside Account Executives to familiarize them with Penji's process and set expectations for success.

? Discovery Planning: Guide each new client through a 30-day discovery period to understand their preferences, design needs, and identify compatible designers for their account.

? 90-Day Success Journey: Walk clients through structured 90-day journey with monthly recap meetings to gather feedback, adjust strategies, and ensure satisfaction milestones are met.

? Strategy Sessions: Schedule and conduct strategy calls to understand clients' 3-6 month goals and proactively plan upcoming projects that align with their objectives.

? Upgrade Identification: Monitor account usage patterns and identify opportunities to upgrade clients (additional design slots, developer add-ons, premium features) to better serve their needs.

? Brand Profile Management: Create and maintain brand profiles for all clients to ensure design consistency and quality across all projects.

? Designer-Client Matching: Collaborate with Project Managers to ensure the right designers are assigned to each client based on style compatibility and expertise.

? Creative Direction: Provide design advice and strategic guidance on client projects through hidden notes, brief clarifications, and direct communication with design teams.

? Quality Oversight: Monitor project quality and report issues with designers, projects, or team performance to maintain high standards.

? Client Retention: Act as primary point of contact for clients, building strong relationships that drive retention beyond the 90-day journey.

? Cross-Team Collaboration: Work closely with Project Managers and Account Executives to coordinate seamless client experiences and project execution.

? Performance Reporting: Track and report on client satisfaction, account health, upgrade opportunities, and portfolio performance metrics.

title: Short-Form Video Editor
description:
Responsibilities:

* Edit short-form video content (Reels, Shorts) using brand guidelines and trending formats

* Craft engaging edits that emphasize storytelling, mood elevation, and product benefits

* Trim, sequence, and time clips for maximum viewer retention and impact

* Incorporate music, captions, text overlays, transitions, and visual effects

* Work with the team to iterate on creative feedback and revisions quickly

* Maintain an organized content library of raw footage, project files, and exports

* Suggest content angles, hooks, and edit styles based on platform trends and insights

* Ensure consistency in video style, pacing, and messaging across different content series

* Assist with repurposing content for paid ads, whitelisting, and promotional campaigns

* Full vlog edits: cutting out unnecessary parts, adding transitions, and ensuring a cohesive flow

* Final cuts on music & performance videos: syncing audio, color grading, subtitling, and adding effect



Requirements:

* 3+ years of experience in short-form video editing, ideally within CPG or eCommerce

* Proficient in editing tools like Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, CapCut, or DaVinci Resolve

* Strong understanding of social media content formats, platform trends, and viral hooks

* Excellent attention to detail with a creative, problem-solving mindset

* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects with tight deadlines

* Fluent in English with strong written and verbal communication skills

* Experience collaborating with content creators, marketing teams, and paid media teams

* Proactive self-starter with a passion for visual storytelling and creativity

* Must be available to work within USA business hours (Minnesota preferred)

* Beneficial if experienced with Riverside, Opus Clip and other AI tools like ChatGPT, SOra & Notebook LM

title: Outbound Sales Representative
description:
Overview

We are seeking a high-energy, execution-focused Outbound Sales Representative to join the team at Earthside Farms. Based in New York City, we are a "better-for-you" snack brand offering clean-label candied nuts and organic dried mangoes to major distributors and retail partners.



This is a pure execution role with high activity, clear metrics, and no fluff. You will be responsible for high-volume prospecting to engage cold leads, re-activate stalled accounts, and drive reorders from existing customers.



Work Structure & Requirements

Location: Remote (Must have a quiet, professional calling environment).

Schedule: Full-time, 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM EST.

Requirement: Candidates must not have a concurrent full-time job to ensure total focus on hitting daily activity targets.

Tech Needs: Reliable high-speed internet and strong computer literacy to multitask across sales tools.



Key Responsibilities

Outbound Outreach: Execute high-volume outbound
s and daily cold calls to prospects and warm leads.

Account Management: Follow up with inactive accounts and call current customers to facilitate reorders, expansion, or reactivation.

Lead Response: Respond promptly to all inbound calls and
 inquiries.

CRM Discipline: Log all activity accurately in Salesforce, maintaining clean data and clear next steps for every lead.

Performance: Consistently hit daily activity targets and monthly pipeline goals.



Required Skills & Experience

Sales Background: Prior experience in outbound sales, inside sales, or lead generation.

Communication: Fluent English (reading, writing, and speaking) with the ability to write concise, non-spammy cold
s.

Phone Presence: Confident, natural delivery on the phone—no monotone script reading.

Resilience: Comfortable handling objections, basic discovery, and repetitive outreach.

Efficiency: Fast typing skills and high attention to detail.



Traits We Value

Metrics-Driven: Comfortable being measured by clear KPIs and pipeline creation.

Coachable: Open to feedback and a direct communicator who strictly follows the established sales process.

Reliable: Consistent and self-disciplined in a remote work setting.



To Apply

Please submit your resume along with a Loom video introducing yourself. In the video, please demonstrate your "natural delivery" by briefly role-playing a 30-second cold call introduction for our organic dried mangoes.



Would you like me to draft a "Daily Activity Scorecard" to include in the onboarding materials for this role?

title: TELEGRAM MARKETING MANAGER (KPI / OPERATOR ROLE) 100% REMOTE
description:
Role Summary

We manage multiple
 channels across the full funnel (Free ? Premium ? Upsells). We’re hiring a
 Marketing Manager who executes daily with speed and consistency: scheduling, posting, time-sensitive updates, and performance iteration. This is not a “creative content” role. This is operator work with clear KPIs.



You will work closely with our copywriter and use existing assets (proof, results, testimonials) to drive engagement and conversions.



What You’ll Do (Daily)

Create, schedule, and post
 content across multiple channels (every day)

Publish time-sensitive updates (trade updates go live — timing is critical)

Turn proof/assets into conversion-focused posts (wins, screenshots, testimonials, recaps)

Execute a weekly content plan + daily adjustments based on performance

Coordinate with the copywriter to stay aligned on voice, structure, and campaigns

Track performance and improve posts through iteration



KPIs (How You’ll Be Measured)

CTR (Primary KPI)

Views / reach per post

Channel growth

Upsells influenced (assisted conversions)

Consistency + speed (no missed posting windows)



Requirements (Must-Have)

Proven experience managing
 channels with a daily posting cadence

Strong English writing (short, punchy, persuasive)

Fast execution: high output without losing quality

Strong understanding of timing, hooks, social proof, urgency, and clear CTAs

Highly reliable: 7-day consistency is non-negotiable

Proven knowledge of forex trading + trading psychology (you can speak trader language and translate concepts into simple
 posts)



Compensation & Work Details

$700–$1,400 USD/month (based on hours + performance)

Performance bonuses tied to results (after trial)

100% Remote

Full-time, long-term

Coverage primarily during the London session (UK time)



How To Apply (Mandatory)



Reply with:

Your
 experience (what channels, niche, daily volume, measurable results)

CV with proven work experience (required)

Proof of work: screenshots/links to
 posts/campaigns you wrote or managed (required)

Confirm your weekly availability in UK time, including weekends

Note: If you cannot commit to strict daily execution and timing, do not apply.

title: Graphs designer / full time
description:
We are an Australian based printing company who focus on the real estate industry.



Our core product is fridge magnets with our biggest seller being yearly calendars. We are looking for someone who has a high level of experience in Adobe Indesign and Illustrator (which is what we use mostly).



We encourage mature females to apply



The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate that they can be trusted to work unsupervised and that they work well under pressure. We have peak periods each year where things go crazy and other periods that are more quiet.



To try and sort the applications I want each applicant to do a small task for me so I can see your technical skills as applicant must have a good knowledge of Illustrator.



Please do not submit an application without submitting the task



We design and produce fridge magnets and other print marketing materials.



This task is for a fridge magnet design only with printing on one side. We use Illustrator for designing fridge magnets.



Harcourts is one of the biggest real estate brands in Australia. Please follow this link to see their current style guide and other files you will need for this task.




/drive/folders/1pwISHWjCNHz6_mlxa_3I0bp8lNh42SDM?usp=sharing



Please design a 2024 calendar in the landscape house shape (the die-cut with specs is included).



Keep the same size of the artboard as it is currently in the ai file. Bleeds – 3mm. Margins for safe cutting 4-5mm.



Change the calendar to 2024 with QLD dates, the calendar with the dates is included as well for your reference (Each state in Australia has their own public and school holidays).



Create a business card size 90x55mm, similar to the examples in the style guide.



The final designs are to be supplied in PDF format, with 3mm bleeds, crop marks and die-cuts included (pink cut line).



Style of the designs should match Harcourts style guide (fonts, layout, colours)



Use these fake details for business cards and house shape:



Nathan Roberts



Sales Representative



Mobile number:
: 



Office details:
Address: Harcourts Your Office, 01 Your Street, Your Town, QLD 4100



Website: 



Slogan: For all your real estate needs.



Please use the photo of the man from the provided link.



I also would like to see the photo with transparent background in PNG format, because very often we need to change backgrounds for light or dark plain colours.



The PNG image must work for both dark and light backgrounds in the provided Harcourts style guide.



If you have read this far, thank you, if you complete this task I get to see how competent you are with illustrator as I am looking for someone with a good knowledge of Illustrator.



If you submit a reasonable effort for this task; that is one calendar and one business card design I will send you 500PHP to pay you for your time.



This is a good ongoing role for someone who os self motivated and can perform consistently.



Pay will start at PHP7000 per week, but we can review that in 3 months depending upon your experience and performance when you start.



Please do not submit an application without submitting the task.



Thanks and hopefully we can talk soon.

title: Sales Representative
description:
About Us

Guaranteed Estimates generates inbound homeowner leads for roofing companies across the U.S. Your job is simple: convert those leads into booked appointments.



This is a performance-driven sales role. If you close well, you earn well.

Move conversations forward with confidence and warmth

Log outcomes accurately in CRM

What We’re Looking For

2+ years of phone sales experience

Proven ability to convert leads

Strong objection handling and follow-up discipline

Confident speaking with U.S.-based homeowners

Clear, neutral English and professional phone presence

Reliable internet and quiet workspace

No side hustles or freelancers, this is a full-time role (we use Hubstaff for time tracking - other work not permitted while on the clock)





Our Core Values

Trust, But Verify: We validate everything. We don’t assume.

Help First: No task is beneath us. We serve the team.

Direct with Respect: High EQ. Honest feedback. Not defensive.

Own the Outcome: No excuses. We deliver.





Compensation

Base: $800 USD/month

Commission: Average performers earn $200–$400 USD/month

Top performers can exceed $1,500 USD/month total

No commission cap; the better you convert, the more you earn.

Record a 2-minute video (using Loom or other free software) answering:

 your resume and video link to:

Pay raise

Work from anywhere that’s quiet and has great internet

title: Customer Support / Success Specialist – B2B SaaS

s

title: Email Growth Strategist
description:
ABOUT THE JOB

Are you an
 marketer who lives in the inbox? Someone who can write a sequence that gets opened, gets replied to, and gets meetings booked? Penji is a fast-growing tech-enabled design platform looking for an
 Marketing Specialist who can own our
 engine end-to-end — from writing and designing sequences to tracking every response and turning replies into booked meetings. If you're data-obsessed, write sharp copy, and want to be the person directly responsible for filling our sales pipeline, apply now.



ABOUT THE COMPANY 

Since 2017, Penji has provided on-demand access to the top 2% of graphic designers. We're the leader in graphic design subscription services and recognized by Inc. Magazine as one of the fastest growing companies. Beyond our business success, we're a community-conscious startup dedicated to supporting nonprofits and those who are helping others. Graphic design is what we do. Being a responsible employer and supporting our communities is who we aim to be. Join us on our mission to leave a positive footprint.



QUALIFICATIONS

? 3+ years of
 marketing experience

? 3+ years of design experience & capable of designing
s in HTML

? Proficiency with HTML coding for

? Experience building and managing multi-step
 sequences

? Proficient with major
 marketing platforms (HubSpot, Mailchimp, ActiveCampaign, Instantly, Smartlead, etc.)

? Experience running and testing multiple campaigns simultaneously

? Proven track record with A/B testing and optimizing based on results

? Strong copywriting skills — especially for outbound and sales
s

? Data-driven mindset with the ability to extract insights from raw data

? Content writing experience



RESPONSIBILITIES

?
 sequences: Build, launch, and manage multi-step outbound
 sequences across all platforms designed to generate responses and book meetings.

? Copywriting: Write compelling, targeted sales and marketing
s that drive opens, replies, and conversions. Every word matters.

?
 design: Design professional
s with little to no assistance. You should be able to concept, design, and code
s yourself.

? HTML coding: Code all
 elements in HTML to ensure they render correctly across all clients and devices.

? Meeting booking: Use every tool and channel at your disposal to convert
 responses into booked sales meetings. This is your north star metric.

? Data tracking & reporting: Track all
 performance data — opens, clicks, replies, bounces, unsubscribes, and meetings booked. Report findings regularly to the team with actionable insights.

? Campaign management: Plan, execute, and monitor targeted campaigns across multiple platforms. Develop A/B tests and experimental campaigns to understand audience behavior and improve results.

? Platform expertise: Maintain deep working knowledge of all major
 marketing platforms. You should know which tool to use and when.

? Response management: Monitor and manage all incoming responses from sequences. Qualify, categorize, and route replies to ensure nothing falls through the cracks.

? Collaboration: Work with designers, marketers, writers, developers, and the sales team to execute campaigns and align
 strategy with revenue goals.

? Constantly learning: Stay on top of
 marketing trends, deliverability best practices, and new tools. Continuously improve your methods. Never stay idle for more than 1 month.

? Reporting: Create and present weekly reports on
 performance, response rates, meetings booked, and pipeline impact.

title: Virtual Assistant – Insurance Team | Full-Time | Remote
description:
Position Summary



We're looking for a highly capable, detail-oriented, and proactive Virtual Assistant to support our Insurance Team at Innovest, a New Zealand-based financial advisory firm. This role is central to keeping our insurance clients progressing smoothly through the advice and application process — from initial data entry through to policy placement.

This is not just a back-office job. You'll be the operational backbone of the team, ensuring nothing falls through the cracks, clients are followed up on time, and our advisers can focus on what they do best.



Key Responsibilities



- Process insurance applications and maintain accurate client records in our CRM

- Follow up with clients via
 and phone to gather outstanding information or provide progress updates

 presence from the ground up.

Brand Strategy and Positioning

mbers to achieve project goals.

title: CRM  gohighlevel CRM
description:
# **CRM  (GoHighLevel Expert) – Asset Recovery Agents of America LLC**



Asset Recovery Agents of America LLC is preparing to launch a new CRM driven operations program for our nationwide surplus recovery business. We are seeking a high level GoHighLevel (GHL) CRM Manager who can build, manage, and maintain our entire CRM infrastructure from the ground up. This is a specialized, no training position, only experienced GHL builders will be considered.



We are not in a rush to hire. We will be interviewing multiple applicants over the next several weeks to ensure we select the right long-term fit. The position is expected to begin in 3–4 weeks.



---



"Position Overview"

You will architect and manage our full CRM ecosystem inside GoHighLevel, supporting our cold?calling teams and ensuring every sub account receives fresh, organized leads daily. Once the system is built, you will oversee the entire CRM program, maintain data hygiene, and manage daily lead uploads across multiple sub accounts.



---



## **Key Responsibilities**

- Build our GoHighLevel CRM **from scratch**, including:

  - Sub accounts  

  - Pipelines  

  - Automations & workflows  

  - Tags, triggers, and custom fields  

  - User permissions & account structure  

- Upload Excel spreadsheets of leads into multiple sub accounts **daily**.  

- Maintain CRM organization, tagging systems, and workflow consistency.  

- Manage CRM operations for our cold calling teams nationwide.  

- Ensure each caller’s sub account receives fresh, accurate leads.  

- Troubleshoot CRM issues and optimize performance.  

- Work directly with company leadership to support program rollout and long term scaling.



---



## **Required Experience**

Applicants must meet **all** of the following:



- **Expert level GoHighLevel experience** (system building, not basic user level).  

- Ability to set up a complete CRM environment from the ground up.  

- Strong understanding of automations, triggers, tagging systems, and workflow logic.  

- Experience managing multi-client or multi sub account environments.  

- Ability to upload, clean, and manage large lead lists.  

- Strong organizational and communication skills.  

- Ability to work independently with **zero training required**.



---



## **Preferred Qualifications**

- Experience supporting cold calling teams or lead generation operations.  

- Experience in surplus recovery, real estate, or legal?adjacent industries (not required).  

- Ability to provide **GHL proof**, such as:

  - Video walkthroughs  

  - Screen recordings  

  - Portfolio examples  

- A clear **voice recording** introducing yourself and your experience.



---

Compensation & Bonus Structure

Compensation will be discussed during interviews and will reflect your experience and ability to manage a high volume, multi account CRM environment. As part of the application process, please provide your monthly rate for full?time CRM management. We will be reviewing multiple applicants, and your quoted price will play a significant role in our hiring decision, as we are looking for a highly skilled manager who can deliver exceptional results while keeping our operational costs reasonable.

In addition to base compensation, the CRM Manager will qualify for a 10% net profit bonus on every surplus recovery case paid out by the company under this team. This bonus is calculated after all legal fees and case related expenses. You will receive this 10% bonus on each surplus case earned by the company as long as you continue managing the CRM program, uploading daily leads, and supporting the cold calling team.

This role offers substantial long-term earning potential. As our cold calling team grows and the number of paid out surplus cases increases, your 10% net profit bonus can scale significantly. The stronger and more efficient you build and manage our CRM system, the more you will earn as our operation expands. 



---



## **How to Apply**

To be considered, please submit your application in **two places**:



### **1. OnlineJobs.ph**

Submit your interest directly on the OnlineJobs.ph platform.



### **2.
 Submission**

 the following to: 

- Your **resume**  

- Any **GHL video proof** or screen recordings  

- A **voice recording** introducing yourself  

- A summary of your GoHighLevel experience  

- Any additional information that demonstrates your expertise  



We will be reviewing many applicants and taking our time to select the right individual who can lead this CRM program for years to come.

title: SEO Specialist
description:
We are a fast-growing Business Advisory and Coaching company helping business owners and leaders scale smarter, perform better, and build high-value organisations. Our work combines practical advisory with leadership and executive coaching to drive real, measurable outcomes.



We are looking for an SEO Specialist who wants to own organic growth and turn search into a predictable acquisition engine. If rankings, traffic, and performance metrics motivate you, this role gives you the space to build, optimise, and scale.



About the Role

This is a hands-on growth role. You will design and execute SEO strategies that increase visibility, attract qualified traffic, and support lead generation across our advisory and coaching services.



We are not looking for surface-level SEO. We want someone who understands strategy, technical foundations, content optimisation, and how SEO directly supports business performance.



What You’ll Be Doing

Developing and executing SEO strategy aligned with business goals

Conducting high-intent keyword research

Optimising on-page content for search performance

Identifying and resolving technical SEO issues

Collaborating on content strategy to drive organic growth

Monitoring rankings, traffic, and performance metrics

Running audits and implementing continuous improvements

Analysing competitors and identifying growth opportunities

Reporting insights and actionable recommendations



What We’re Looking For

Proven SEO experience with measurable results

Strong understanding of on-page, off-page, and technical SEO

Data-driven, performance-focused mindset

Familiarity with SEO and analytics tools

Clear communication and reporting skills

Self-driven, organised, and results-oriented

Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment

Someone who takes ownership and pushes for growth



Nice to Have

Experience with SEO for professional services, advisory, or coaching businesses

Content optimisation with a conversion-focused approach



Compensation & Incentives

Salary is negotiable and will depend on skills, experience, and demonstrated capability. Bonuses and performance incentives are available for the right candidate who consistently achieves agreed KPIs and objectives. We reward measurable impact and contribution to growth.



Work Structure

Full-time remote role

Hours: 8:00 am to 5:00 pm Sydney, Australia time

One-hour lunch break

Results-driven culture with clear expectations



What Success Looks Like

Strong improvements in rankings for high-value keywords

Growth in qualified organic traffic

SEO contributing directly to lead generation

How to Apply

 with the subject line: SEO Specialist Application – [Your Name].

title: Online Setter / Lead Conversion VA (Health & Fitness) — Hong Kong gym

Key responsibilities

 Messenger, Instagram DMs, WhatsApp,

, Google Workspace, Calendly, and any CRM

Nice-to-have

Work hours:

 your application with the exact subject line: pink pad Cadillac

title: Short-Form Video Editor (AI & After Effects) — Instagram/TikTok
description:
JOB TITLE: Social Media Visual Editor — AI Persona & Aspirational Short-Form

SALARY: $1,100 USD/month

TYPE: Full-time (40 hours/week)

LOCATION: Remote (Philippines)

SCHEDULE: Async, with Vancouver overlap (PST) for feedback



---



The Mission



Prismiera is a luxury jewelry brand with a short-form video series already producing cinematic content on YouTube — mythology, history, goddess archetypes, and Dark Academia aesthetics.



We need someone to own the Instagram and TikTok side.



This is NOT repurposing YouTube content into different aspect ratios. This is building platform-native content that makes a woman feel powerful in under 20 seconds. You'll take assets from our YouTube production pipeline — AI-generated footage, voiceovers, atmospheric visuals — and reimagine them into aspirational, music-synced, scroll-stopping edits and cinematic skits designed for how Instagram and TikTok audiences actually consume.



The other half of this role: you'll be working with our AI-generated personas who serve as the visual anchor across our short-form content. You'll composite, integrate, and stylize AI-generated character visuals into edits that feel striking and intentional, not gimmicky. If the idea of building a visual identity around an AI persona excites you, keep reading!



---



The Style



The content mix you'll produce:



65% VIBE & SCENARIO — The kind of reel a woman sends to her group chat with no caption because the vibe speaks for itself. 



25% CINEMATIC SKITS — High-end, visually stunning executions of viral formats and dark humor. The premise can be slightly unhinged or ironic, but the visuals never break luxury. Think high-end perfume commercial meets TikTok audio trend. The Goddess is never the butt of the joke — she's the punchline, and she always wins.



10% SENSORY / EXPERIMENTAL — Layered, fast, loop-optimized. Visual overload with mythological texture. The algorithmic wildcard.



YES: Aspirational. Lethal elegance. Fashion-edit energy. Dark femininity. Music-driven impact. Content that feels like a luxury car reel meets ancient mythology. Cinematic skits using our AI personas — high-production value, deadpan, surreal, or darkly ironic.

NO: CapCut presets. Generic motivational quote reels. Low-effort vlog-style acting. Slapstick comedy. Anything that looks like it was made in Canva. Anything that cheapens a demi-luxury product.



---



What You'll Do



Rework & Reimagine: Take footage, AI-generated visuals, and audio from our YouTube production pipeline and build Instagram/TikTok-native edits. Same mythology, completely different content shape. You're not resizing — you're rebuilding with a different audience in mind.



Cinematic Skits: Build short-form skits around our AI personas that use trending formats, dark humor, or deadpan irony — executed at a visual level that never drops below luxury. People share it for the joke, follow the page for the aesthetic.



AI Persona Integration: Composite and stylize our AI-generated characters into edits and skits as a visual anchor. She's not a narrator in your content — she's the presence. The face the eye locks onto while mythology and music layers move around her.



Music-Sync Editing: Your cuts, transitions, and visual reveals are married to the beat. You understand rhythm as a storytelling tool. Swells, drops, silence, impact — all intentional.



Platform Instinct: You understand what Instagram rewards vs. what TikTok rewards. You know what gets saved on IG. You know what gets looped on TikTok. You design for those behaviors, not just for visual quality.



Instagram Packaging: Beyond the Reel itself — you contribute to grid cohesion, caption strategy, and Story sequencing. The profile should make someone think "I want to be part of this" within 2 seconds of landing.



Volume at Speed: Once your templates and aesthetic are locked, your turnaround per piece should be significantly faster than building from zero. We expect high output.



---



Core Requirements



After Effects (Mandatory). Compositing, layering, motion graphics, light/shadow matching. This is your primary tool. You build visual experiences, not just cuts.



Premiere Pro. For project handoffs and consistency with the rest of the team.



The Aesthetic Eye. You instinctively know the difference between aspirational and try-hard. Between elegant and overproduced. Between powerful and loud. Your edits make people feel something before they consciously understand what they're looking at.



Music & Rhythm. You've made edits where the music drives the visuals — AMVs, fashion reels, phonk edits, fan edits, whatever. You understand pacing as a weapon. You know what "the drop" means and you know when NOT to use it.



AI Comfort. You'll be working with AI-generated visuals daily — both assets from our pipeline and tools we give you direct access to (Seedance 2.0, Seedream, and whatever launches next). You treat AI output as raw material to be refined, not finished product.



Loop Thinking. You design edits that reward rewatching. The cut that lands on beat, the detail you only catch the second time, the seamless loop point. You think in circles, not lines.



Strong English. Daily async communication — clear, direct, professional.



Reliable & Coachable. You hit deadlines or warn early. You take direct feedback and iterate fast. You flag problems with options, not excuses.



---



Bonus Skills (Not Required, But We'll Notice)



- Color grading — pushing AI output and mixed footage into a consistent luxury palette

- Typography sense — text overlays that feel intentional and premium

- Sound design — SFX layering beyond just music (risers, hits, atmospheric texture)

- Carousel / static design for Instagram companion posts

- Understanding of Instagram analytics — saves, shares, completion rates, and what drives them

- Experience building visual identities for brands or personas on social media



---



Weekly Output



Ramp-up (first 2–3 weeks): 3–5 reworks as you learn the brand aesthetic, lock your AE templates, and calibrate with the team.

Steady state: 8–15 reworks per week across Instagram and TikTok. Individual rework turnaround target: 1–3 hours once templates are established.



---



How This Role Fits



Other editors handle cinematic YouTube production and visual effects — you own social media. Same mythology, same brand, different platform behavior. Each editor has a distinct lane, and yours is how Prismiera looks and feels on Instagram and TikTok.



---



System Requirements



RAM: 16GB minimum (32GB preferred) + SSD

Reliable high-speed internet (upload speed matters)

Must run After Effects, Premiere Pro, and browser-based AI tools simultaneously



---



Paid Trial (Shortlisted Candidates)



Before any full-time commitment, we run a weekly paid trial. We provide real assets from our production pipeline, style references, and the AI persona visuals. You deliver reworks. Trial is compensated at $250 USD at the end of each week. If it's a mutual fit after 30 days, we transition to regular bi-weekly payments (before work).



This protects both sides — you see whether the work fits your strengths, we see whether the output fits our brand.



---



What We Offer



- Paid accounts for all frontier AI tools — Seedance 2.0, Seedream, and whatever launches next

- Creative ownership — you're defining how a luxury brand looks and feels on Instagram and TikTok from day one

- An AI persona to build around — not a hypothetical, an active visual identity you'll shape and evolve

- A role that evolves as the tools evolve — this job will look different in six months, and that's the point

- Clear briefs — asset libraries, mood references, and specific direction for every batch

- Direct feedback — specific, constructive notes on every edit

- A brand worth building — Prismiera launches soon. A second AI-native brand is incubating behind it. You're not joining a finished machine. You're helping build one.



---



Compensation



$1,100 USD/month. Paid trial at $250 USD/week, transitioning to bi-weekly payments of $550 (before work) after 30 days.



---



Ownership & Confidentiality



All outputs (edits, project files, prompts, generated assets, persona visuals) are Prismiera property and must remain confidential.



---



How to Apply



Do not send a generic cover letter.

Use 7 apply points or more when applying.



Subject line: PRISMIERA SOCIAL — [Your Name]



Send the following (in this order):



1. The Vibe Test. Link to ONE edit you've made that is aspirational, aesthetic, or fashion-adjacent — or a skit that demonstrates platform-native virality instinct. Format doesn't matter. The feeling does.



2. The Rhythm Test. Link to ONE edit where the music drives the visuals. Show us your beat-sync instinct. (Can overlap with #1 if one video demonstrates both.)



3. The Creative Instinct Test (3–5 sentences total). You're given a 45-second cinematic video about a queen who poisoned her entire court, a folder of our AI Goddess visuals, and a dark atmospheric beat. Pitch two reworks: (A) a 15-second Instagram Reel designed to get saved — tell us your audio choice, pacing, and what the first 2 seconds look like; and (B) a 15-second cinematic skit that uses dark or deadpan humor without losing the luxury feel.



4. AI Experience (1–2 sentences). What is your experience level with generative AI tools? If none, say so — we'll evaluate the rest on its own merits.



5. Hardware. Your PC specs: CPU / GPU / RAM. Plus your internet upload speed.



6. Turnaround Estimate. Given existing footage, a music track, and an established AE template — how long would a 15–20 second rework take you?



7. The Rewrite. Rewrite this sentence to sound dark, powerful, and aspirational: "She is really cool and strong and she wins."

title: Campaign Communications Coordinator (Contract)
description:
Campaign Communications Coordinator (Contract)

Monday-Thursday (9am-1pm EST) Flex Hours

Remote



Position Overview:

The Campaign Communications Coordinator will play a central role in shaping and executing the campaign’s communications strategy. This position is responsible for developing clear, disciplined messaging across earned media, digital platforms, and campaign materials. The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker with strong writing skills, political awareness, and the ability to operate effectively in a high-visibility, fast-paced environment.



Key Responsibilities:



Draft and distribute press releases, media advisories, and official statements



Develop message guidance, talking points, and briefing materials



Assist with speechwriting and debate preparation materials



Monitor news cycles and recommend rapid response messaging when necessary



Coordinate with digital, fundraising, and field teams to ensure message alignment



Track and report on earned media coverage and press engagement



Qualifications:



Exceptional writing, editing, and storytelling ability



Experience in political campaigns, public policy, or public affairs communications preferred



Understanding of media relations and message discipline



Ability to manage multiple deadlines under pressure



Professional judgment and discretion



Structure & Reporting:

Contract position. Reports to the Campaign Manager and works closely with the Candidate and Digital Team to maintain cohesive messaging across all platforms.

? Work Setup

ing:

title: Full-Time Long-Form YouTube & Vlog Editor (New Frames Media)
description:
ABOUT NEW FRAMES MEDIA



New Frames Media is a growing content production company on a mission to create world-class YouTube and video content. We are in the early stages of building something special, and we are looking for someone who wants to grow with us from the ground floor. This is not a gig. This is the start of a long-term career opportunity with a company that is scaling fast.



We need a FULL-TIME long-form YouTube editor and vlog editor who can handle everything — vlogs, documentaries, educational content, lifestyle content, and viral-style long-form videos. You need to be a creative powerhouse who understands pacing, storytelling, clip selection, and visual flow.



---



WHAT YOU WILL BE EDITING



- Long-form YouTube videos (10-40+ minutes) — vlogs, day-in-the-life, documentaries, educational/how-to content

- Lifestyle and entrepreneur content with cinematic quality

- Viral-style long-form content that keeps viewers hooked from start to finish

- Educational and business content with clean pacing and professional delivery

- Documentary-style storytelling with narrative arcs, b-roll integration, and emotional beats



---



EDITING STYLE REFERENCES — STUDY THESE CAREFULLY



We want our content to look and feel like the channels below. Before applying, you MUST watch at least 2-3 videos from EACH creator to understand the style, pacing, and energy we are going for.



1. DIGITAL RONEL 
 on YouTube — 15.6K subs)

Digital Ronel creates polished long-form content about building businesses and scaling e-commerce brands. His editing is clean, well-paced, and educational with a personal touch.



Watch these examples:

- "What I'd Do Differently If I Started Ecom Again as a Beginner" — 
 (Great example of educational pacing, clean transitions, and keeping the viewer engaged through value-driven content)

- "I Went To China To Meet My Dropshipping Suppliers..." — 
 (Vlog-style with strong storytelling, good use of b-roll, and documentary feel)



2. BREZ 
 on YouTube — 459K subs)

Brez creates high-energy lifestyle and entrepreneur vlogs. His editing is fast-paced, cinematic, and keeps the energy up throughout. Great use of music, transitions, and visual storytelling.



Watch these examples:

- "i bought a $500,000 rolls royce cullinan and feel nothing..." — 
 (518K views — cinematic vlog editing, great pacing and music selection, lifestyle storytelling)

- "i had the CRAZIEST weekend in miami (ft. Jake Paul)" — 
 (201K views — fast-paced event-style vlog, multiple locations, high energy editing with clean transitions)

- "10 future billionaires vs miami" — 
 (122K views — group content with great clip selection, pacing, and narrative structure)



3. WHOP 
 on YouTube — 228K subs)

Whop creates polished, documentary-style profiles of entrepreneurs and creators. Their editing is cinematic, well-structured, and tells compelling stories with strong visual identity.



Watch these examples:

- "Inside Stable Ronaldo's $10M Streaming Empire" — 
 (Documentary-style with professional pacing, strong narrative arc, and polished post-production)

- "Inside the $10M Vault of a Watch Trading Genius" — 
 (Clean visual storytelling, cinematic b-roll, great use of graphics and text overlays)

- "Inside Clix's $20M Fortnite Empire" — 
 (High production value, engaging structure, and professional documentary feel)



4. DYSON ALLEN 
 on YouTube — 2.84K subs)

This is our founder's channel. This is the style and energy we are building toward. You need to understand how we want our personal brand content to look and feel.



Watch these examples:

- "5 Brutal Truths About Amazon FBA Nobody Tells You ($1.6M Seller at 20)" — 
 (Educational long-form with strong hooks, good pacing, and value-driven content)

- "A Day in My Life Running Multiple Businesses at 20" — 
 (Day-in-the-life vlog style, lifestyle content with personal branding)

- "I Made $500 in 10 Mins (Then My Day Got CRAZY)" — 
 (Fast-paced vlog with storytelling, good clip selection and energy)



---



REQUIRED SKILLS — NON-NEGOTIABLE



- Adobe Premiere Pro (expert level — this is your primary tool)

- Adobe After Effects (motion graphics, text animations, transitions, visual effects)

- Strong understanding of PACING — knowing when to speed up, slow down, cut, hold

- Clip selection — being able to review raw footage and pick the best 
nts

- Color grading and color correction

- Sound design, audio mixing, and music selection

- Documentary-style editing with narrative structure

- Vlog editing with high-energy, fast-paced cuts

- Educational content editing with clean delivery and visual aids

- B-roll integration and cinematic transitions

- Text overlays, lower thirds, and graphics

- Thumbnail concepts (bonus, not required)

- Excellent English skills (written and spoken)



---



WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR IN A PERSON



- Someone who eats, sleeps, and breathes video editing

- A hustler who goes above and beyond — not someone who does the bare minimum and clocks out

- Someone who can take raw footage and turn it into a STORY, not just a sequence of clips

- Self-motivated and proactive — you do not wait to be told what to do, you figure it out

- Fast turnaround without sacrificing quality

- Open to feedback and willing to iterate quickly

- Understands YouTube as a platform — what works, what gets clicks, what keeps people watching



---



COMPENSATION AND DETAILS



- Rate: $3/hour ($480-$560/month depending on hours)

- Hours: 40 hours/week, full-time

- Long-term position — we are looking for someone to grow with us, not a freelancer

- This is a REMOTE position



---



SCHEDULE AND WORKING HOURS



This is a semi-US hours position. Because our team is US-based, we need significant overlap for real-time communication. You will need to work either:



- Early morning shift: Starting around 6-8 AM PHT (Philippines Time)

- Late night shift: Working until around 12-2 AM PHT



We understand this is a commitment — that is why we are looking for someone who is serious and dedicated. Solid overlapping hours mean faster feedback, quicker turnarounds, and a stronger working relationship. This is non-negotiable.



---



WHY JOIN NEW FRAMES MEDIA?



We are not some faceless company. We are a small, hungry startup building content brands from scratch. The right person will have a massive opportunity to grow with us, take on more responsibility, and become a core part of our creative team. But it also means we need someone who can handle the pace and pressure of early-stage growth.



---



HOW TO APPLY — READ CAREFULLY



If you do not follow these instructions exactly, your application will be ignored.



1. Send your portfolio. NOT your generic reel. We want to see long-form YouTube edits — vlogs, documentaries, educational content. If your work does not match the style and quality of Digital Ronel, Brez, Whop, or Dyson Allen, please do not apply.



2. Include links to your work. YouTube links, Google Drive, Vimeo — we do not care where, as long as we can watch it.



3. Tell us about your experience with Adobe Premiere Pro AND After Effects. How long have you been using them? What is your skill level? Give us specifics.



4. In 2-3 sentences, tell us why YOU are the right fit. What makes you different from the hundreds of other editors on this platform?



5. Tell us which of the four reference creators (Digital Ronel, Brez, Whop, Dyson Allen) you think has the best editing style and why. This tells us you actually went and studied their content.



6. Include your WhatsApp number so we can contact you directly for faster communication.



7. Confirm you can work semi-US hours. This role requires working early morning (starting around 6-8 AM PHT) OR late evening (until around 12-2 AM PHT) to maximize overlapping communication hours with our US-based team.



Applications that are clearly copy-pasted, generic, or missing any of the above will be discarded. We want to find the RIGHT person, not just any person.



---



IMPORTANT — READ THIS: To prove you have read this entire listing and are not mass-applying, you MUST begin your application message with the exact phrase: "I spread peanut butter on my resume." Applications that do not start with this phrase will be immediately discarded. No exceptions.

title: Full-Time Podcast Editor - Long-Form & Short-Form Content (New Frames Media)
description:
ABOUT NEW FRAMES MEDIA



New Frames Media is a growing content production company on a mission to create world-class podcast and video content. We are in the early stages of building something special, and we are looking for someone who wants to grow with us from the ground floor. This is not a gig. This is the start of a long-term career opportunity with a company that rewards hustle, creativity, and ownership.



If you want to be part of building a media brand that stands out, keeps growing, and pushes creative boundaries — keep reading.



---



THE ROLE



We are hiring a full-time podcast editor who can handle both long-form podcast episodes (60–90+ minutes) and short-form clips (30–90 seconds) for platforms like YouTube Shorts, TikTok, and Instagram Reels.



You will be responsible for transforming raw podcast recordings into polished, engaging, scroll-stopping content that keeps audiences watching. This means you need to understand pacing, storytelling, audio quality, visual hooks, dynamic captions, and modern editing trends.



---



EDITING STYLE REFERENCES — STUDY THESE



Your editing style should match the quality and energy of these three creators. If you do not know who they are, go watch their content before applying.



1. JACK NEEL 
 on YouTube — 3.32M subscribers)



LONG-FORM EXAMPLES:

• "Manipulation Expert: How to Control Any Conversation and Read Their Mind Instantly!" (2.6M views) — 
 — Notice how tight the pacing is. No dead air. The editing keeps you locked in for over 2 hours with clean audio, well-timed cuts, and immersive visuals layered throughout the conversation.

• "How to Outsmart A Narcissist & Spot Liars Instantly! — Robert Greene" — 
 — Great example of long-form interview editing with a high-profile guest. Smooth transitions, professional audio mix, and the content flows naturally without losing the viewer.



SHORT-FORM EXAMPLES:

• "How Your Face Reveals Your Personality" (18M views) — 
 — Punchy hook in the first second, fast-paced delivery, tight editing that keeps retention sky-high.

• "Dr. Mike Israetel Plays 2 Truths and 1 Lie" (10M views) — 
 — Great clip selection from a longer episode. The hook grabs you instantly, and the editing keeps the energy up throughout.



2. OPEN RESIDENCY 
 on YouTube — 36.9K subscribers)

Host: Mark Brazil (Co-Founder of IKONICK)



LONG-FORM EXAMPLES:

• "Content Masterclass: The Most Valuable 3 Hours For Any Business Owner in 2026" with Kallaway (71K views) — 
 — Clean, professional podcast editing. Great audio quality, polished transitions, and a conversational flow that feels effortless. This is the standard for business podcast editing.

• "How to Actually Dominate on YouTube in 2026" with Samir Chaudry of Colin and Samir (43K views) — 
 — Notice the professional thumbnail, chapter markers, and how the editing enhances the conversation without overdoing it.



SHORT-FORM EXAMPLES:

• "The $1.5M Ad Is Dead: AI Changed Everything" (9.6K views) — 
 — Clean, professional clip with strong hook and good pacing. Shows how to pull a compelling 
nt from a longer conversation.

• "How Steve Jobs Turned a Rival Into an Acquisition" (9.2K views) — 
 — Great storytelling clip. Short, punchy, and makes you want to watch the full episode.



3. ROB THE BANK — Robert Oliver 
 on YouTube — 86.3K subscribers)





LONG-FORM EXAMPLES:

• "The Psychology of Making Money" — 
 — Raw, authentic long-form content with strong hooks and engaging pacing. Notice the b-roll, graphics, and energy that keep viewers engaged throughout.

• "How I Mastered the Law Of Detachment To Make Millions" — 
 — Storytelling-driven long-form with motivational energy. Good example of blending talking-head footage with dynamic visuals.



SHORT-FORM EXAMPLES:

• Rob's TikTok 
 — 
 — His short-form editing style is the benchmark. Strong hooks in the first 3 seconds, dynamic word-by-word captions with emphasis and branded fonts, jump cuts, zooms, sound effects, and b-roll. Every video is a 60-second masterclass — simple, bold, and story-based. Study his entire feed.



---



WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU



• Edit full-length podcast episodes (60–90+ minutes) with professional audio mixing, pacing, and storytelling

• Create 5–10+ short-form clips per episode for YouTube Shorts, TikTok, and Instagram Reels

• Apply Rob the Bank-style editing to short-form: strong hooks, dynamic captions, zooms, jump cuts, SFX, and b-roll

• Deliver Jack Neel and Open Residency-level quality on long-form: tight pacing, clean audio, immersive visuals

• Maintain excellent English communication skills — you must understand context, humor, and conversational flow to make great editorial decisions

• Hit deadlines consistently — we move fast and expect reliability

• Be proactive. Suggest ideas, flag issues, improve the content without being asked



---



TOOLS & SKILLS REQUIRED



• Adobe Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or Final Cut Pro (proficiency required)

• After Effects or equivalent for motion graphics and dynamic captions

• Strong audio editing skills (noise removal, leveling, EQ, compression)

• Familiarity with caption tools (CapCut, Captions app, or manual SRT workflows)

• Reliable high-speed internet and a capable editing workstation

• Excellent written and spoken English



---



COMPENSATION & SCHEDULE



• Rate: $3.00 USD per hour

• Hours: 40 hours per week (full-time)

• Schedule: Flexible within reason — but deadlines are non-negotiable

• Type: Long-term, ongoing position

• Growth: As we grow, you grow. We are building from the ground up, and early tea
mbers who prove themselves will have opportunities for raises, leadership roles, and creative ownership



---



WHO WE WANT



We are not looking for someone who clocks in, does the bare minimum, and clocks out. We want a hustler. Someone who takes pride in their craft, goes above and beyond, and treats this like their own company. If you are the type of person who sometimes puts in extra hours because you want the content to be perfect — not because someone told you to — you are our person.



New Frames Media is a startup. We are building something from scratch. That means the right person will have a massive opportunity to grow with us, take on more responsibility, and become a core part of our creative team. But it also means we need someone who can handle the pace and the pressure of early-stage growth.



---



SCHEDULE & WORKING HOURS



This is a semi-US hours position. Because our team is US-based, we need significant overlap for real-time communication. You will need to work either:



- Early morning shift: Starting around 6-8 AM PHT (Philippines Time)

- Late night shift: Working until around 12-2 AM PHT



We understand this is a commitment — that is why we are looking for someone who is serious and dedicated. Solid overlapping hours mean faster feedback, quicker turnarounds, and a stronger working relationship. This is non-negotiable.



---



HOW TO APPLY — READ CAREFULLY



If you do not follow these instructions exactly, your application will be ignored.



1. Start your message with: "I spread peanut butter on my resume." This proves you read the full listing.



2. Send your portfolio. NOT your generic reel that you send to everyone. We want to see work that is SIMILAR to what we described above. Send us your best long-form podcast edit AND your best short-form clips. If your work does not match the style and quality of Jack Neel, Open Residency, or Rob the Bank, please do not apply.



3. Include links to your work. YouTube links, Google Drive, Vimeo — we do not care where, as long as we can watch it easily. No WeTransfer links that expire. No files we have to download.



4. Tell us in 2–3 sentences: Why are you the right editor for New Frames Media? What makes you different from the hundreds of other editors on this platform?



5. Tell us which of the three reference creators (Jack Neel, Open Residency, Rob the Bank) you think has the best editing style and why. This tells us you actually went and studied their content.



6. Include your WhatsApp number so we can contact you directly for faster communication.



7. Confirm you can work semi-US hours. This role requires working early morning (starting around 6-8 AM PHT) OR late evening (until around 12-2 AM PHT) to maximize overlapping communication hours with our US-based team. We need real-time collaboration, not just async handoffs.



Applications that are clearly copy-pasted, generic, or missing any of the above will be discarded. We want to find the RIGHT person, not just any person.



---



?? IMPORTANT — READ THIS FIRST: To prove you have read this entire listing and are not mass-applying, you MUST begin your application message with the exact phrase: "I spread peanut butter on my resume." Applications that do not start with this phrase will be immediately discarded. No exceptions.

title: Virtual Assistant / Social Media Manager
description:
Corine Farms is a growing agricultural business focused on sustainable farming, food production, and community partnerships. We are expanding and need a highly organized, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant who can manage backend operations while helping us grow sales and visibility through social media and strategic outreach.



This is not just a posting job. This role supports the operational backbone of the farm.



 Position Overview



You will be responsible for keeping our backend organized, compliant, and running smoothly while also helping increase product sales and partnerships through outreach and social media.



Core Responsibilities



Backend & Administrative Operations:



• Manage and maintain the management calendar

• Respond to
s professionally and promptly

• Complete and submit applications for state programs and agricultural initiatives

• Maintain paperwork for USDA, state agencies, and government contracts

• Track compliance deadlines, renewals, and certifications

• Organize digital filing systems and documentation

• Coordinate vendor and food pick-ups

• Maintain clear communication with processing partners and vendors



Outreach & Growth:



• Reach out to restaurants, churches, and local organizations to introduce Corine Farms and our services

• Develop and maintain local partnerships

• Support farm-to-table relationship building

• Follow up on leads and partnership opportunities



Social Media & Sales Growth:



• Develop and execute a consistent social media strategy

• Create engaging content aligned with our farm brand

• Increase followers and engagement organically

• Drive product sales via social media

• Monitor analytics and improve performance

• Ensure a smooth and professional user experience across platforms



Primary Goals



• Organized and fully compliant backend systems

• Strong community partnerships and vendor relationships

• Increased product sales

• Consistent brand visibility and digital growth



Ideal Candidate



You are:



• Highly organized and extremely detail-oriented

• Able to work independently without constant supervision

• Strong in written and verbal communication

• Comfortable completing official applications and regulatory paperwork

• Confident in professional outreach and relationship building

• Experienced in social media growth and content execution

• Deadline-driven and proactive



Experience with agriculture, food systems, or government compliance is a strong plus.



Employment Terms



• 90-day probation period

• Performance evaluation at the end of probation

• Long-term opportunity for growth



If you are self-motivated, organized, and ready to help build a growing farm brand from the inside out, we want to hear from you.

title: AI Agent Engineer - React/Next.js (Part-Time, Remote)
description:
Help ship features for Story Stream (AI-powered editing platform for fiction writers). You'll take features from 80% done to production-ready by continuing Claude Code sessions, running tests, fixing bugs, and verifying UI works correctly.



This is NOT traditional coding. You won't write much code from scratch. Instead:

- Continue AI agent conversations (Claude Code) that the founder starts

- Run our Jest test suite (2,000+ tests), verify features work

- Fix small bugs, polish UI details (button placement, hover states, theme issues)

- Submit clean PRs, flag issues that need founder input



Example day: Receive 3 tasks in ClickUp. Each has a GitHub branch or Claude Code link. You iterate with Claude Code until tests pass and UI looks right. Report back what's done.



REQUIRED SKILLS



- Can read React/Next.js code (don't need to write from scratch)

- Comfortable with AI coding tools (Claude, Cursor, Copilot) or willing to learn

- Can run npm test and understand what failed

- Strong attention to detail - catches misalignment, broken hover states

- Git basics - checkout branches, read diffs, submit PRs

- Excellent written English

- Self-directed - work independently, know when to escalate



YOU DON'T NEED



- 10+ years experience or senior title

- Ability to architect systems

- CS degree or algorithm expertise



WORK DETAILS



- $10/hour to start, raises after 30-60 days for great work

- 10-12 hours/week, flexible schedule, async-friendly

- Paid monthly via Wise as independent contractor

- Twice-weekly video check-ins (15-30 min)

- Daily ClickUp communication for questions



HOW TO APPLY



1. Required: 2-3 min video showing you using an AI coding tool (Claude/ChatGPT/Copilot) OR explaining your testing process

2. GitHub profile (required)

3. Answer (2-3 sentences): "You start Claude Code to fix a button but it creates 3 new bugs. What do you do?"



TRIAL PROCESS



- Short application review (2-3 days)

- 15-min video interview if strong

- Paid trial ($75-100): Complete real feature with Claude Code

- Decision within 48 hours



Start immediately | Work directly with founder-CTO | Async-first culture

title: Audit Senior
Intermediate / Senior Auditor
description:
At AMW Audit Group, we focus solely on external audit—and we do it exceptionally well. As one of Australia’s trusted independent audit firms, we support schools, charities, private businesses, and SMSFs across the country.

We’re now looking for experienced SMSF auditors to join our growing offshore team. This is a long-term, fully remote opportunity where your expertise is valued, your time is respected, and your work-life balance is protected.



You’ll work closely with our in-house team to audit SMSFs for Australian clients, following ATO standards from planning through to reporting. The role offers competitive pay, a flexible work setup, a realistic workload, and a team culture built on trust and clear communication.



We’re looking for auditors with proven SMSF experience and a solid grasp of Australian audit standards. CA, CPA, or equivalent qualifications are welcome, but what matters most is your attention to detail, professional mindset, and ability to deliver quality work independently.

If you’re looking for a stable role with a supportive team, we’d love to hear from you.



SMSF Intermediate/Senior Auditor Qualifications:



• At least 2 years audit experience including experience in SMSF audit and/or SMSF administration

• Prior Big 4 audit experience is a plus

• Knowledge of Australian Auditing Standards

• Knowledge of the SIS Act and Regulations

• Experience in SMSF accounting software e.g. Class, BGL is a plus

Additional requirements:

• High attention to detail

• Ability to work independently and with teams

• A positive attitude and willingness to learn



Job Description:

• Auditing SMSF Financial Statements and SIS compliance

• Working on a daily basis with audit manager/s

• Gaining knowledge of Superannuation laws and updates



Kindly
 your updated CV:

title: Marketing Assistant - Social Media Content (Part-Time, Remote)
description:

s to new users (using our templates)



Workflow: Founder provides raw materials (video clips, quotes, ideas). You produce polished content, submit for review initially. After proving quality, may post directly.



REQUIRED SKILLS



- CapCut video editing - portfolio required

- TikTok/Instagram savvy - understand hooks, pacing, captions

YOU DON'T NEED



- Marketing degree

- Paid ads or SEO expertise

- Professional videography



PLATFORM PRIORITY



1. TikTok (primary)

2. Instagram (secondary)

3. YouTube Shorts (tertiary)



WORK DETAILS

BRAND VOICE



(Detailed examples provided during onboarding)

HOW TO APPLY

TRIAL PROCESS

Start immediately | Work directly with founder | Content goes through review initially

?

title: Ecommerce Team Lead (Shopee, Lazada, Tiktok, Bigseller)
description:
URGENT HIRING



Join our team and become part of a dynamic, global organization of 40 professionals across Korea, Singapore, Malaysia, and the Philippines. Collaborate closely with our regional teams to grow an exciting portfolio of leading Korean brands, including Beauty of Joseon, Needly, Tirtir, and other top-trending names in the market.



We are seeking an experienced person who can manage a brand's health independently and turn data into growth strategies; managing seller accounts and tea
mbers.



Key Responsibilities:

- Monitor SOPs for campaign execution, product listing (SEO-optimized), and performance reporting to ensure high-quality output.

- Oversee task progress and execute final quality checks on all pre-launch deliverables, including voucher setups, flash sale nominations, and campaign banners.

- Conduct competitor price analysis and market trends to deliver actionable insights.

- Monitoring of orders, GMV (Sales), campaigns, product listings, prices, promotions for accounts.

- Organize and follow up cases by calling or
ing e-commerce platforms (e.g., Refund/Return disputes, customer complaints, and fraud prevention).

- Track and report on Ad Performance (ROAS/ACOS) and key sales metrics, providing the Senior Team Lead with recommendations.

- Conduct daily team check-ins to review pending tasks, proactively address immediate roadblocks, and ensure team alignment on platform priorities (e.g., campaign launches, inventory checks).

- Other ad-hoc tasks and support to the stakeholders.



Qualifications:

- 4–5 years of experience in E-commerce Account Management or Operations, with deep knowledge of Shopee Seller Centre, Lazada Seller Center, and TikTok Shop.

- Proven experience in a supervisory level managing remote teams.

- Advanced skills in Google sheets and Excel. Managing large datasets, utilizing advanced formulas (e.g., VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables), and generating performance reports.

- Highly organized, able to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

- Strong communication skills with the ability to work effectively in multicultural teams.

- Seeking a dedicated full-time and long term role.



Benefits:

- Stable full time employment with leave benefits, up to 14 days annual leave, public holiday leave, birthday leave.

- Travel Opportunity to Singapore based on performance.

- Comfortable work environment, same working time zone as Philippines (GMT +8).

- Structured salary increase and promotion based on performance.



To apply, please answer a few short pre-screening questions via the Google Form linked below. This helps us better understand your background and fit for the role before the interview stage.







We appreciate your interest and look forward to hearing from you!

title: Outbound Enrollment Closer – Career Certification Programs (Remote, EST)
description:
Outbound Enrollment Closer – Career Certification Programs (Remote, EST)



This is not customer service.

This is not inbound order-taking.



This is a phone-driven, outbound enrollment closer role for professionals who know how to control a consult, qualify fast, overcome objections, and close.



We are a U.S.-based online career school enrolling students into IT and Project Management certification programs (CompTIA, PMP, and related tracks). We provide warm leads. You bring the discipline, urgency, and closing skill.



What You’ll Be Doing (Daily Reality)



Make high-volume outbound calls to prospective students



Run structured, consultative enrollment calls (needs analysis ? recommendation ? close)



Control the call, set next steps, and ask for the enrollment



Handle objections around price, time, confidence, and urgency



Follow up relentlessly until the prospect converts or disqualifies



Log activity and outcomes accurately in CRM



Hit daily activity targets and monthly enrollment goals



Improve close rates through coaching, scripts, and call reviews



If you don’t like calling, this role will break you.



Who This Role Is For



Proven outbound / inside sales closers



Comfortable dialing daily and living on the phone



Strong command of English with clear U.S. cultural fluency



Confident asking direct questions and pushing for decisions



Competitive, coachable, metrics-driven



Organized and accountable without supervision



Experience selling education, training, coaching, or professional services is a major plus



Familiarity with certifications (CompTIA, PMP) helps—but closing ability matters more



Bachelor’s degree required



Who Should NOT Apply



Anyone who needs inbound-only leads



Anyone uncomfortable asking for money



Anyone who avoids objection handling



Anyone who wants a “soft” admissions role



Anyone who disappears when targets tighten



Schedule



Monday–Friday



10:00 AM – 6:30 PM EST



Compensation



Base pay: $1,200–$1,600 USD per month



Performance-based advancement and leadership path



Long-term role with stability and growth for performers



(Top performers move fast. Average performers don’t last.)



What You Get



Warm leads with real intent



Clear scripts, frameworks, and coaching



No gimmicks, no fake promises—just real programs that work



A sales culture that rewards results



Bottom Line



If you can:



Control a sales conversation



Build urgency without lying



Close consistently



Take coaching and improve



You will win here.



If not—this role will expose you quickly.

title: Salesforce Developer (Integrations & App Development)
description:
About the Role



Will consider both part-time and full time applicants.



We are seeking an experienced Salesforce Developer to design, build, and maintain custom Salesforce applications that integrate with third-party systems. This role is highly technical and hands-on, focused on creating scalable, secure, and well-architected solutions that extend Salesforce beyond its core capabilities.



You will work closely with stakeholders, architects, and integration partners to translate business requirements into high-quality Salesforce applications and integrations.



Key Responsibilities



Design, develop, and deploy custom Salesforce applications using Apex, Lightning Web Components (LWC), and Salesforce APIs



Build and maintain integrations between Salesforce and third-party systems using REST, SOAP, and event-based architectures



Develop managed or unmanaged packages as needed to support reusable application components



Implement authentication and security best practices, including OAuth and named credentials



Optimize application performance, scalability, and maintainability



Write clean, testable code with appropriate unit test coverage



Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve application and integration issues



Collaborate with solution architects, admins, and business stakeholders to refine technical requirements



Contribute to technical documentation and architectural decision-making



Stay current with Salesforce platform updates and integration best practices



Required Qualifications



Salesforce Platform Developer II certification (required)



3+ years of hands-on Salesforce development experience



Strong proficiency in:



Apex (including asynchronous processing)



Lightning Web Components (LWC)



Salesforce APIs (REST, SOAP, Bulk, Platform Events)



Experience integrating Salesforce with external systems (ERP, marketing platforms, data warehouses, or custom applications)



Solid understanding of Salesforce security, sharing models, and governor limits



Experience with source control (Git) and CI/CD processes



Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail



Preferred Qualifications



Experience building or supporting managed packages



Familiarity with middleware platforms (e.g., MuleSoft, Boomi, Workato)



Experience with Salesforce Data Cloud or event-driven architectures



Knowledge of OAuth flows and external identity providers

title: QBO Accounting Leader
description:
QBO Accounting Leader

Mandatory Assessment: 



Chris Corzo Injury Attorneys is hiring a steady, detail-driven Accountant who prefers defined routines and measurable completion—daily checklists, weekly reconciliation cadence, and a reliable monthly close. This role is for someone who genuinely enjoys:



• reconciling accounts until they’re clean and provable

• building repeatable checklists + SOPs

• operating on a steady daily/weekly/monthly cadence

• keeping financial work audit-ready, not “close enough”



Important: This job is 100% synchronous with our team in US Central Time (not async).

________________________________________



What You’ll Own (Core Responsibilities)



1) Trust Fund and Case Accounting (Top Priority)

• Maintain precise trust activity (deposits, disbursements, balances) with documentation that matches approvals

• Ensure case-level accounting ties out cleanly (no mystery variances)

• Keep records compliance-minded and ready for review at any time

2) Employee Payroll & Benefits Support

• Execute payroll accurately and on schedule

• Maintain payroll/benefits documentation and coordinate updates as needed

• Reconcile payroll-related accounts and ensure correct coding

3) Reconciliations (6 Accounts + Credit Cards)

• Perform reconciliations on a consistent cadence (weekly/monthly as assigned)

• Identify discrepancies quickly, resolve cleanly, and document the fix

• Maintain reconciliation proof and organized backup

4) Detailed Forecasting + Participation on BI Team

• Provide reliable forecasting inputs with clear assumptions

• Support BI reporting with accurate source data and consistent definitions

• Help leadership see what’s true now and what’s coming next

5) Build and Maintain Finance SOPs

• Create SOPs that are usable, clear, and repeatable

• Improve workflows for speed, accuracy, and internal controls

• Keep processes consistent as volume increases

________________________________________



How We Work



• 100% synchronous Central Time workday

• Clear priorities, clean handoffs, and documented work

• You will send a daily End-of-Day (EOD) report with:

o Accomplishments

o Work in Progress (WIP)

o What’s Next (tomorrow’s plan)

o Current Focus

o Stucks / Needs / Requests



If you like predictable execution, measurable progress, and clean accountability, you’ll fit here.

________________________________________



What “Great” Looks Like



• Trust fund and case accounting is consistently tight, documented, and reliable

• Reconciliations stay current with no loose ends

• Forecasting inputs are organized and defensible

• SOPs reduce friction and make the finance function scalable

• Leadership never has to chase you for status—your EOD report keeps everything aligned

________________________________________



Requirements



• 3–5 years accounting experience

• Strong reconciliation habits and high attention to detail

• Comfortable building SOPs while continuing execution

• Able to work 50+ hours/week when needed

• Able to work 100% synchronous Central Time

________________________________________

Compensation

$26,000 – $45,000/year, based on experience and demonstrated performance.

________________________________________

To Apply



• Mandatory Assessment: 

• Send Resume

Salon Marketing Solutions is an Australian-based marketing education company supporting beauty salons, skin clinics, and aesthetic businesses across Australia and New Zealand. We provide done-for-you campaigns, strategic mentoring, and practical tools to help clinic owners grow consistently and confidently.



We are now looking for an experienced Go High Level (GHL) Specialist to join our implementation team on a part-time basis.



About the Role:



This is a technical implementation role ideal for a GHL expert who can confidently build, manage, and troubleshoot funnels, automations, and CRM functions across multiple campaigns and projects.



You’ll be supporting both internal marketing initiatives and client campaign delivery — with room to grow into a long-term, high-responsibility role.



Key Responsibilities:



- Build and manage funnels and landing pages inside Go High Level

- Create automations,
/SMS sequences, pipelines, calendars, and triggers

- Set up and manage client CRM environments (including integrations)

- Troubleshoot tech issues across GHL workflows, forms, and campaign elements

- Run split-tests on landing pages, opt-ins, and campaigns

- Manage reporting dashboards, call tracking, and data insights

- Provide implementation support to our team and clients

- Ensure all work follows best practice and brand guidelines



Must-Have Skills & Experience:



- Minimum 2+ years proven experience with Go High Level (you will be tested)

- Demonstrated experience with full GHL builds (funnels, automations,
/SMS, CRM)

- Ability to follow style guides and build on-brand pages

- Strong attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills

- Fast and responsive communication on Slack

- Reliable, consistent, and available for part-time hours daily

- Experience working with agencies or beauty/aesthetics clients is a plus 

- Familiarity with Mailchimp, Squarespace, WordPress

- Basic design skills using Canva or similar tools



What's in it for you? 



- Part-Time – 25 hours per week (Monday to Friday, flexible hours)

- Week 1–12 (Probationary Period): AUD $175/week

- After probation (Month 4–12): AUD $225/week

- After 12 months: AUD $275/week

- Annual Pay Increase: 10% from Year 2 onwards

- Performance Bonuses: Equal to one week’s pay if KPIs are achieved

- Stable, long-term role with growth potential

- Supportive, values-driven team environment

- High-performing team with 7–8 year staff tenure



We’re excited to welcome a detail-oriented, technically strong GHL Specialist to our team. If you’re passionate about marketing tech, implementation, and long-term growth — apply now on this link:

title: Bookkeeping
description:

This role is for someone who understands:

 • Multi-account reconciliation

 • Investment tracking

?



Core Responsibilities
