 • Track large purchases (vehicles, property, investments)



2. Investment & Asset Tracking

 • Monitor brokerage accounts

 • Track realized vs unrealized gains

 • Maintain cost basis records

 • Maintain investment summary dashboard

4. Tax Preparation Support

 • Maintain documentation for audits

5. Credit & Debt Oversight

 • Monitor credit utilization

 • Track loan balances

 • Track mortgage payments

 • Monitor interest rates and obligations



?



Required Qualifications

 • 3+ years bookkeeping experience

 • Experience working with high-income individuals or entrepreneurs

 • Strong QuickBooks or similar software experience

 • Comfortable managing multiple accounts simultaneously

 • High discretion and confidentiality

 • Strong understanding of:

 • Cash vs accrual

 • Capital gains

 • Owner draws vs distributions

 • Entity separation



?



Bonus Qualifications

 • Experience tracking crypto and trading activity

 • Experience tracking private investments

 • Familiarity with real estate bookkeeping

 • Basic financial planning knowledge

 • Experience preparing financial summaries for lenders

title: Customer Service Representative Job Description
description:
Job Title: Customer Representative

Compensation: $600/month



About Us

We’re a dynamic agency driven by growth, innovation, and the desire to make an impact. By combining smart systems with human creativity, we empower brands to streamline, scale, and stay ahead of the curve.



Position Overview

We are seeking a communicative and detail-oriented Customer Representative to serve as the bridge to our customers. This role is ideal for a professional who thrives on solving problems, building relationships, and delivering exceptional customer experiences. If you enjoy a fast-paced, collaborative environment and are passionate about helping others, we’d love to hear from you.



Key Responsibilities

Customer Interaction: Respond to customer inquiries via
, chat, or social channels using Gorgias our centralized customer support platform. Ensure responses are prompt, personalized, and reflect our commitment to empowering confident, radiant skin.





Issue Resolution: Troubleshoot order concerns, product-related questions, and skincare guidance with empathy and efficiency. Escalate complex issues to appropriate teams when needed, always aiming to deliver a seamless customer experience.





Support Services: Educate customers on our skincare line, product benefits, usage recommendations, and order processes. Become a trusted guide for helping clients find the right routines and feel confident in their choices.





Feedback Loop: Capture customer insights and feedback through support interactions and proactively share them with product and operations teams to inform continuous improvement.





Required Qualifications

Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Ability to empathize and connect with a diverse range of clients.

Organized, detail-oriented, and capable of multitasking efficiently.

Proactive problem-solver with a positive attitude.



Previous experience in customer service or client-facing roles is a plus.

Must have Shopify Experience

Experience with Gorgias and similar ticketing systems is required

Compensation & Benefits

Competitive monthly salary of $400.

bonuses up to $160/4 weeks

A collaborative, high-energy work culture.

Opportunities for skill-building and career growth.







Our Culture & Values

At our agency, we’re fast, collaborative, and laser-focused on results. We believe in:

Excellence over Perfection: Done is better than perfect but we never settle for anything less than great work.

Open Communication: Feedback is a tool for growth, not a weapon.

Integrity Always: We act with transparency, honesty, and trust every step of the way.

We thrive on a proactive, honest, and performance-driven environment and we’re looking for people who do too!



Application Process

skyandsol-careers.replit.app/

title: Senior Controller / CPA (US-Based Service Business)
description:
We are a fast-growing U.S.-based junk removal company doing ~$10M/year, and we are looking for a high-level Controller / Senior Accountant to take full ownership of our financial operations.



This is NOT a basic bookkeeping role. We are looking for someone who can think like a business operator, not just record transactions.

Track and report:



cost per job



labor %



dump fees



truck profitability

accrual accounting



financial reporting



job costing

IDEAL CANDIDATE:

COMPENSATION:

 to

title: Operations Research Associate (Intelligence & Outreach)
description:
ABOUT US

Revel Street is mapping the private dining world. We provide "venue intelligence" to the world’s most demanding corporate clients. To do this, we need researchers who are part investigator, part concierge, and 100?tail-oriented.



THE ROLE

 outreach, ensuring our database is the most complete in the industry.



CORE TASKS

 threads with venue stakeholders to extract specific data points.

- Quality Governance: Taking ownership of "Data Truth"—if it’s in our system, it must be 100?curate.



REQUIREMENTS

- Persuasive Writing: You can write
s that actually get a response from busy managers.

- High Standards: You have a "premium" eye and understand the nuances of the luxury market.

- Reliability: You thrive in a long-term, 40-hour-per-week role working directly with founders.

title: Supply Chain Manager (Dropshipping E-commerce)
description:
We are a fast-growing e-commerce company operating multiple high-volume dropshipping stores across various niches. To support our continued growth, we are looking for an experienced Supply Chain Manager who can optimize supplier relationships, improve fulfillment performance, and ensure operational excellence across our supply chain.



Role Overview



As Supply Chain Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the entire supply chain process — from supplier sourcing to final delivery to the customer. Your goal is to improve delivery times, reduce disputes and refunds, maintain product quality, and protect profit margins.



Key Responsibilities



Manage and negotiate with international suppliers



Source and onboard reliable new suppliers and fulfillment agents



Optimize shipping lines, delivery times, and logistics performance



Monitor daily order fulfillment and tracking performance



Proactively resolve shipping issues and escalations



Analyze supplier performance and implement improvements



Reduce dispute rates, refund rates, and chargebacks



Track and report key KPIs (delivery times, fulfillment accuracy, dispute rate, etc.)



Collaborate closely with customer service and marketing teams



Required Qualifications



Proven experience in dropshipping supply chain management (high-volume stores preferred)



Strong experience working with international suppliers (China and EU agents preferred)



Advanced proficiency in Google Sheets (data analysis, reporting, tracking KPIs)



Experience using Slack for team communication



Excellent written and verbal communication skills



Experience using ParcelPanel and/or Parcelwill for tracking and logistics management



Strong negotiation and problem-solving skills



Highly organized and data-driven mindset



What We Offer



Full-time position (remote possible)



Competitive salary based on experience



Performance-based bonus structure



Opportunity to grow within a fast-scaling e-commerce company



High level of responsibility and autonomy



If you meet the qualifications and are interested in this position, please apply and include the word “mango” at the end of your application so we know you have read the full job description.

title: Sales & Business Development Manager (SaaS)
description:
About Omnicierge



Omnicierge is redefining how e-commerce brands drive revenue, without discount codes. Instead of relying on promotions that erode margins and brand value, we enable merchants to offer controlled, dynamic price negotiation directly on their Shopify stores. It also act as an AI Sales Concierge where the AI agent supports customer on selecting products, upsell, cross-sella and finally price negotiation. 



We are expanding globally and looking for ambitious Sales and Business Development Managers to help us onboard Shopify merchants across multiple territories.



The Role



This is a full-cycle outbound sales and onboarding role.



You will identify, approach, and convert Shopify merchants into Omnicierge clients,  owning the process from first outreach (cold calling included) through demo, negotiation, onboarding support, and early-stage customer success.



This is not a call-centre role. We are looking for commercially sharp, confident professionals who can speak with founders, e-commerce managers, and marketing directors as trusted advisors.



Key Responsibilities:



- Proactively identify and outreach Shopify merchants in assigned territories



- Craft personalised cold
s and LinkedIn outreach messages



- Qualify leads, cold calling leads and book discovery/demo calls



- Deliver product demos confidently and professionally



- Address objections and position Omnicierge strategically (not as a chatbot, but as a pricing innovation tool)



- Close deals and manage contract handover



- Support merchants during onboarding (installation, configuration guidance, initial training)



- Provide light customer success follow-up during early implementation



- Maintain CRM hygiene and accurate pipeline reporting



Requirements



- 5+ years experience in SaaS sales, business development, or outbound sales in any of these countries (Australia, China, Indonesia, Malaysia, Japan, Philippine, Middle East, USA, Canada, South Africa)



- Experience selling to e-commerce brands (Shopify experience highly preferred)



- Strong understanding of digital commerce, conversion, and pricing strategies



- Fluent English with neutral accent (client-facing confidence required)



- Additional language skills highly preferred depending on territory (e.g. Arabic for Middle East, etc.)



- Strong objection-handling and consultative selling skills



- Self-driven and comfortable working in a remote, performance-focused environment



What We’re Looking For



- Commercial thinker — not just a script reader



- Able to explain complex ideas simply



- Confident speaking with founders and senior decision-makers



- Organised, disciplined, and KPI-driven



- Hungry to grow with a scaling SaaS company



Compensation



- Competitive base salary



- Attractive commission structure (uncapped)



- Performance bonuses



- Opportunity to grow into Territory Lead roles



Why Join Haggle?



- Be part of a new category in e-commerce pricing



- Sell a differentiated product (not another marketing tool)



- Work directly with founders



- Global exposure across multiple markets



- High growth potential



If you find yourself a strong candidate, send me a message titles "BDM [Full Name] - [Preferred Territory]" 

Also include a detailed cover letter, Resume and perhaps a short video of yourself explains your suitability

title: Sales & Operations Manager
description:
About SparklePro



SparklePro is a fast-growing commercial cleaning company focused on high-quality recurring contracts and operational excellence. We service office buildings, medical facilities, retail, restaurants, and multi-location commercial properties.



We are building a scalable, systems-driven organization and are looking for a Sales & Operations Manager to help drive revenue and ensure smooth execution.



Position Overview



The Sales & Operations Manager is responsible for converting inbound leads into recurring commercial contracts and ensuring those contracts are properly staffed and executed.



This role owns the full lifecycle of a client:



Inbound call ? Quote ? Close ? Staff ? Maintain ? Retain



This is a revenue-impact position that requires strong communication skills, operational thinking, and leadership ability.



Key Responsibilities



Sales Responsibilities



• Answer and respond to inbound commercial cleaning inquiries

• Qualify prospects and understand scope requirements

• Conduct virtual or in-person walkthroughs as needed

• Build and deliver professional quotes

• Close recurring commercial contracts

• Maintain high close rate and protect company margins



Operations Responsibilities



• Assign and staff jobs with subcontractors

• Ensure proper scheduling and service coverage

• Maintain communication between customers and field teams

• Resolve service issues quickly and professionally

• Conduct quality control follow-ups

• Monitor job profitability



Relationship Management



• Build long-term relationships with commercial clients

• Conduct regular check-ins with customers

• Maintain strong subcontractor relationships

• Ensure subcontractors meet performance standards

• Address performance issues and replace crews if necessary



Performance & Accountability



• Track close rates and revenue targets

• Maintain job margin standards

• Ensure retention of recurring accounts

• Help build scalable systems and processes



Qualifications



• 2+ years in sales, operations, or account management

• Experience in commercial cleaning, facility services, or home services preferred

• Strong phone sales and closing ability

• Excellent organizational and follow-up skills

• Comfortable managing subcontractors and service teams

• Ability to think both strategically and operationally



Compensation Structure



Base Salary: (Insert Range)

Performance Bonus: Based on revenue closed and retention

Commission Opportunities: Recurring contract incentives



Ideal Candidate Traits



• Strong closer

• Calm under pressure

• Detail-oriented

• Accountable and self-driven

• Relationship-focused

• Thinks like a business owner



Growth Opportunity



This role has clear potential to grow into a Director of Operations or VP-level position as SparklePro scales.

title: Night-Shift Operations Support (11:30 PM – 9:30 AM, Long-Term Only)
description:
Night-Shift Customer Support Specialist (Full-Time, Remote)

Shift: 11:30 PM – 9:30 AM (Asia Timezone)



Salary & Benefits



$450–$500/month (Fixed)



6-Month Performance Review (Salary increase based on reliability & accuracy)



13th Month Pay after 12 months (PH standard)



Long-term stable position



About Us



We are a global payment service provider (PAYJN) operating in India, Indonesia, LATAM, and Southeast Asia.



We provide payment infrastructure services to online merchants.



This is NOT a call center job.

This is a structured, SOP-based operational support role.



 Work Schedule



Night Shift (Asia Timezone)

11:30 PM – 9:30 AM

10 hours per shift

6 days per week



Low workload overall, but must stay online and responsive during the entire shift.



Long idle periods are normal — but availability is mandatory.



Responsibilities



Reply to merchants through



Use internal BOT tools to check payment status



Follow internal SOP strictly (no improvisation allowed)



Provide clear and accurate English communication



Escalate technical issues properly



Maintain TimeDoctor active during entire shift



?? Important: Please Read Carefully



This role requires:



• Strict discipline

• Full shift availability

• No disappearing during duty

• No multitasking other jobs during shift

• No mobile-only work (must use computer)



Even during idle hours, you must remain alert and responsive.



If you are looking for flexible hours, part-time work, or side-income only — this role is NOT suitable.



We are looking for someone who wants long-term stability and respects responsibility.



? Requirements



Excellent English comprehension



Fast typing & quick response



Able to follow instructions 100%



Stable internet (minimum 50 Mbps recommended)



Own computer (not phone)



Quiet working environment



Comfortable with long-term night shift



Preferably 25 years old and above



Long-term commitment (1 year+) required



 Training Process



We provide structured SOP training.



Training period: 5–7 days



Training includes:

• BOT command usage

• Payment checking procedure

• Escalation process

• Communication style standardization



After training, probation period = 3 months.



Performance is evaluated based on:

• Response speed

• Accuracy

• Shift discipline

• Attendance



How to Apply



Please send:



Short introduction (include age & current living situation)



Confirmation you accept 11:30 PM – 9:30 AM shift



Internet speed test screenshot



Previous customer support experience



Why you want a long-term night-shift position



Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Remote Registered Nurse (RN) – Virtual Medical Assistant
description:
Full-Time | Up to 40 Hours/Week | Long-Term Role

Schedule: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM PST 

(May adjust in the future to 4:00 AM – 12:00 PM PST)

No Other Job Commitments Allowed



About the Role

We are a growing U.S.-based medical practice seeking a highly competent, detail-oriented Registered Nurse (RN) to serve as a remote Clinical Operations Partner to the provider.

This is not a basic VA position.

We are looking for a nurse who can think clinically, communicate professionally, and operate independently in a fast-paced, high-standard environment.

You will work directly with the provider via secure remote systems (TeamViewer, EMR, CRM platforms) and play a critical role in patient communication, case preparation, reporting, and operational efficiency.

________________________________________

Core Responsibilities

Clinical Support

• Review and analyze patient charts prior to provider visits

• Prepare structured clinical summaries

• Draft professional medical reports (training provided)

• Identify missing documentation or follow-up needs

• Maintain strict HIPAA compliance

Patient Communication

• Answer inbound patient calls professionally

• Respond to patient messages with clarity and clinical judgment

• Assist with medication-related coordination (when applicable)

Outreach & Lead Coordination

• Send up to 20 targeted outreach
s per day (templates provided)

• Maintain accurate daily tracking in Excel

• Move qualified leads through pipeline

• Send scheduling links to interested professionals

Operational & Financial Support

• Complete structured daily financial summary reports

• Assist with document creation for practice growth

• Support social media management (training provided)

________________________________________

We Are Looking For Someone Who:

• Holds an active RN license

• Has prior experience in a U.S.-based clinic, telehealth, or remote healthcare role

• Writes and speaks exceptional English 

• Understands medical terminology and clinical workflows

• Is highly organized and proactive

• Is comfortable communicating with patients and healthcare professionals

• Maintains professional composure and discretion at all times.

________________________________________

Technical Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

• Wired high-speed internet (25+ Mbps) with backup connection

• High-performance computer capable of running EMR + remote access software

• Noise-canceling headset, quiet, distraction-free workspace

• Backup laptop preferred (reimbursement or new laptop will be provided after 6 months of employment)

________________________________________

This Role Is NOT For:

• Entry-level virtual assistants

• Nurses looking for temporary work

• Candidates juggling multiple jobs

• Individuals who require constant supervision

________________________________________

Compensation

Competitive hourly rate based on experience and skill level 

Performance-based increases available for high performers.

Long-term growth opportunity within a stable, expanding medical practice.

________________________________________

Application Instructions

To be considered, submit:

1. Resume

2. 1–2 minute professional introduction video

3. Screenshot of internet speed test

4. WhatsApp contact for scheduling

5. In your proposal, include the word “Clinical” to confirm attention to detail

We are hiring for excellence, not availability.

If you are a high-performing RN who values professionalism, autonomy, and long-term growth — we would like to speak with you.

title: Work-from-Home Opportunity with Australian Criminal Law Firm – Long-Term Role | Weekend Shift (Sunday-Thursday)
description:
Work-from-Home Opportunity with Australian Criminal Law Firm – Long-Term Role | Weekend Shift (Sunday- Thursday)



We are a criminal law firm based in Australia, previously working with external call centres, but now building our dedicated in-house remote team. We currently have 5 valued tea
mbers based in the Philippines and are looking to add a Sixth for a long-term position.







Position Overview



This is a home-based, full-time role with the potential to earn up to PHP 100,000/month — starting at PHP 50,000 during training, with a raise to PHP 81,500 post-training, and bonuses up to PHP 10,000 based on commissions.







Schedule & Hours



-Permanent shift: From Sunday- Thursday



-Days off: Friday- Saturday



-11.5 hours per day (including a 45-minute lunch break)



-Working hours: 7:00 AM to approx. 6:30 PM ( There will be a rotation of roster so there are weeks where you only work from 6 AM to 2 PM Philippine time (aligned with Australian business hours and nightphones)



-Training schedule: Monday to Friday until fully trained



- Entitled to 15 vacation leaves







Your Duties Will Include:



-Answering incoming calls and handling client inquiries professionally



-Recording call details and booking appointments in our database



-Learning the basics of criminal law in Australia



-Providing frontline call management and transferring messages



-Managing live chat inquiries



- Collecting payment during after-hrs only



-Assisting with after-hours and weekend nightphones





What We're Looking For:



-Fluent English speaker with strong writing and spelling skills



-Reliable computer, high-speed internet, second monitor, and quality headphones (Bluetooth is preferred)



-Availability for full-time work only — no side jobs or agency representation



-A strong team player who is eager to learn, grow, and contribute long-term



-Willingness to work on Philippine holidays (with holiday pay already factored in)



-Rarely take leaves on a weekend.







Why Join Us?



-Work closely with a team of 35+ Australian lawyers and staff



-Join a growing and stable firm that values its remote team



-Receive thorough training and continuous support



-Enjoy long-term stability — our current PH team has been with us for 3+ years



-We pay the 13th month and offer performance-based bonuses







How to Apply:



-Please submit a voice and video introduction (e.g., via Vocaroo) sharing:



-A short introduction about yourself



-Your relevant experience



-Why you think you’d be a great fit for this role



-Provide your resume as well.



- Provide a typing test



-Only applicants who submit a voice or video introduction will be considered.







Do NOT apply if:



You’re an agency



You plan to take on another job



You don’t meet the equipment or availability requirements



We use real-time communication tools during working hours, and full commitment to this role is essential.







This is a great opportunity to join a respected and fast-growing Australian law firm ( Dribbin & Brown Criminal Lawyers). Before joining, we’re happy to connect you with our current Filipino staff so you can hear firsthand about the role and work environment.



We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Transportation Tracker
description:
AJG Transport is expanding its route operations division and seeking a reliable, detail-oriented professional to help support and streamline our daily duties. We are looking for a Transportation Tracker to support real time fleet movement, manage load data accuracy, and ensure smooth coordination between drivers, customers, and internal teams. This role is ideal for someone highly organized, proactive, and comfortable operating in a fast paced logistics environment where precision matters



Role Overview

As an Transportation Tracker, you will serve as a real time control point within route operations. Your responsibility is to ensure loads are properly assigned, tracked, updated, and documented while maintaining consistent communication across drivers, brokers, and customers. You will operate within structured SOPs while making fast, sound operational decisions when challenges arise.



What You’ll Be Doing

• Assign and dispatch loads based on driver availability, Hours of Service, and customer requirements

• Monitor live fleet movement using GPS and TMS

• Track and update ETAs, check calls, timestamps, and delivery milestones in real time

• Enter, audit, and maintain accurate load data in Google Sheets and TMS

• Communicate continuously with drivers, brokers, and customers regarding status updates

• Identify delays, route conflicts, detention risks, or service issues and take proactive action

• Escalate operational risks to leadership when necessary

• Generate shift based operational reports summarizing load activity and exceptions

• Follow dispatch, communication, and escalation SOPs consistently

• Maintain clean shift handoffs and organized documentation



What Success Looks Like

• TMS, Google Sheets, and tracking platforms reflect complete and error free data at all times

• Scheduled updates are sent on time

• Critical loads are monitored closely and handled with urgency from start to finish

• Communication is clear, concise, and actionable, both in written updates and verbal escalations

• Operational risks and issues are flagged early with solutions, not just problems

• Shift handoffs are smooth, complete, and well documented

• You become someone the team can depend on during high pressure situations



Who We’re Looking For

• Has experience in logistics, freight brokerage, dispatch, or transportation tracking

• Understanding of fleet coordination, load planning, and HOS awareness

• Familiar with US geography and US logistics trucking operations (a plus)

• Ability to monitor multiple loads and drivers simultaneously

• Understands urgency and prioritization in a live dispatch environment

• Communicates clearly and professionally via zoom, chat, and

• Minimum 45 WPM typing speed

• Can monitor multiple loads at once without losing accuracy

• Pays strong attention to detail and uses sound judgment when issues arise

• Comfortable operating in high volume communication environments

• Follows instructions consistently and values clean execution

• Works well with a team and is open to feedback and coaching. Collaborates without resistance or ego



Why Join AJG Transport?

• Permanent remote opportunity

• Structured systems and clear expectations

• Hands on leadership and direct feedback

• Defined KPIs and measurable growth

• Opportunity to grow within a scaling freight brokerage

• Performance recognition and advancement potential



Schedule & Work Setup

• Full Time Remote Role| Direct Hire to US Company

• Tuesday - Saturday 7 AM - 5 PM CST (San Antonio time)

• Wednesday - Sunday 8 PM - 5 AM CST (San Antonio time)

• Zoom presence (with camera open and unmuted audio) required

• Time tracking software used for accountability and performance support

• Shifts may adjust based on operational demand



If you thrive in fast moving transportation operations, understand the importance of real time coordination, and can execute with precision under pressure, we want to hear from you.

title: Virtual Assistant – YouTube Niche & Algorithm Research (Ongoing)
description:
I run multiple YouTube channels across a wide range of topics and need help understanding how YouTube's algorithm recommends content to different types of viewers.



What You'll Do:

Log into a provided browser profile and spend ~30 minutes browsing YouTube

Browse once or twice a day (morning/evening) for 7 days per profile

Watch 5-8 videos across a variety of topics — one profile might be all true crime and history, the next might be cooking and travel, another might be anime and gaming

Engage naturally — subscribe to a couple channels, like a few videos, leave the occasional comment

Each profile represents a different viewer persona, so your viewing should vary between them



Why:

I'm mapping out how YouTube's recommendation engine behaves across hundreds of different content niches. Each profile helps me see what gets surfaced for different audience types so I can make better content decisions.

Ideal Candidate:



Naturally curious — you don't mind bouncing between UFC highlights, space documentaries, and fashion hauls in the same week

Consistent and trustworthy (you'll be given login credentials to browser profiles)

Long-term availability preferred — assignments come in batches (usually 2-3 at a time)



Pay:

$4/hr, approximately 0.5 hrs/day (3.5 hours per week)

~$14 per 7-day assignment

Volume depends on project needs — not guaranteed weekly



This is a low-effort, ongoing role. You're basically getting paid to watch YouTube — the only ask is that you follow the viewing guidelines for each profile and keep things natural.

title: Executive Assistant (Business & Personal Affairs – Strong HR Background)
description:
Role Summary



You will serve as the Founder/CEO’s trusted right hand, providing high-level executive, HR, and personal support across multiple businesses. This is a senior, hands-on role focused on organization, follow-through, and disciplined execution — not a traditional secretarial position.



Key Responsibilities

1) Executive & Business Support



Manage the Founder’s calendar, meetings, travel, and priorities.



Prepare meeting agendas, minutes, and track action items.



Handle business correspondence and confidential documents.



Liaise with senior managers, partners, and external stakeholders.



Maintain organized and secure company records.



2) HR & Organizational Support



Maintain accurate employee records and HR documentation.



Coordinate payroll, attendance, and HR compliance.



Support recruitment (interviews, offers, candidate communication).



Oversee onboarding and offboarding.



Ensure compliance with Saudi labor law.



Assist in updating HR policies and job descriptions.



3) Cross-Business Follow-Up



Track and monitor tasks issued by the Founder.



Convert instructions into clear, trackable actions.



Prepare weekly/monthly executive reports (progress, risks, priorities).



Ensure strong execution discipline across teams.



4) Personal Support to Founder



Manage personal calendar, travel, and key appointments.



Coordinate family schedules and confidential matters.



Liaise with approved service providers.



Maintain personal documents (visas, IDs, insurance, etc.).



Prevent conflicts between business and personal schedules.



5) Systems & Task Management



Use tools like ClickUp, Notion, Asana, or Monday.



Build and maintain task dashboards and follow-up systems.



Translate verbal instructions into structured tasks.



Support a highly organized, system-driven work environment.



Adapt quickly to new tools and workflows.



Qualifications



Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business Administration, or related field.



5–7 years supporting senior executives.



Strong hands-on HR operations experience.



Good understanding of Saudi labor law.



Fluent in English.



Required Skills



Excellent organization and prioritization.



Strong HR knowledge.



Advanced task management (ClickUp or similar).



Clear communication and high emotional intelligence.



Absolute confidentiality and professionalism.



Ability to manage fast-moving priorities.



Proficient in Microsoft Office / Google Workspace.



Personal Traits



Highly trustworthy and dependable.



Proactive and solution-oriented.



Calm under pressure.



Detail-focused with strong ownership mindset.



Thinks and acts like an executive partner.



Success Metrics (KPIs)



Founder’s time is well-protected and optimized.



Tasks are tracked and closed on time.



HR records are accurate and compliant.



Executive reports are clear and timely.



Noticeable reduction in Founder’s daily operational load.





TO APPLY: answer these 3 questions. 



How do you communicate instructions coming from the CEO?



How do you follow up without creating resistance?



What tools you know how to use ( clickup ? notion? monday ? ) and share how you can help the CEO in using it to plan his tasks?

title: Interior Designer – 2D, 3D & Rendering Specialist (Mid to Senior)
description:
We are looking for a mid-level Interior Designer with expertise in 2D drafting, 3D modelling, and high-quality rendering to support design development and documentation for residential and commercial projects. The ideal candidate can translate design concepts into accurate 2D drawings, detailed 3D models, and visually compelling renderings, delivering work independently with precision and accountability.



Key Responsibilities



2D Design Documentation:

-Develop detailed 2D drawings, including floor plans, space planning, elevations, sections, furniture layouts, and joinery details

-Produce cabinetry, interior construction, and finish details

-Ensure drawings are clear, accurate, and ready for construction

-Update and coordinate drawings throughout different design phases

-Maintain consistency and accuracy across all documentation



3D Modelling & Rendering:

-Build and maintain accurate 3D models to support design development

-Create high-quality renderings for client presentations and internal reviews

-Apply materials, textures, lighting, and camera settings effectively

-Revise models and renderings to reflect design updates and coordination changes



Design Development & Coordination:



-Collaborate with senior designers to refine design intent

-Identify and flag inconsistencies or constructability issues in drawings and models

-Ensure alignment between 2D documentation, 3D models, and rendered visuals

-Assist in preparing client presentations and submission materials



Software & Technical Skills (Mandatory)



-AutoCAD – advanced proficiency

-SketchUp – advanced proficiency

-3D rendering software (Enscape, V-Ray, Lumion, Twinmotion) – proficient

-Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign) – working knowledge



Experience & Qualifications

-Diploma or Degree in Interior Design or equivalent

-3–6 years of relevant interior design experience

-Proven track record in producing technical drawings, 3D models, and renderings

-Strong understanding of interior detailing and construction methodology

-Experience with residential and/or commercial projects

-Experience working with Singapore clients or exposure to Singapore industry standards is highly preferred due to the nature of the role.



Working Style & Expectations

-Capable of working independently with minimal supervision

-Detail-oriented, organised, and deadline-driven

-Open to feedback and able to implement design revisions

-Communicates reliably and maintains responsiveness in a remote setup

-Takes accountability for accuracy, coordination, and completeness of assigned work





Click this link to apply,

title: Transport New Furniture Deliveries - Customer Support (Australia Time Zone)
description:

Work From Home Opportunity



About the Role



This work-from-home role provides critical team support and customer experience management for the New Furniture Department, handling last mile services across Australian cities, with a focus on Melbourne suburbs. You will act as the first line of dispatch, managing end-client enquiries, coordinating delivery schedules , and liaising with end-clients to ensure timely and accurate deliveries.



The role requires a proactive individual with a strong sense of urgency, who can capture information concisely and in detail, manage data using Excel and CSV uploads, and utilise last mile tracking systems. You will also understand and work within various service agreements to ensure client expectations and service standards are met.

________________________________________



Key Requirements



•	Experience or aptitude to act as the first line of dispatch, managing initial client enquiries and delivery coordination.

•	Thrives in a fast-paced environment with a proactive mindset and a strong sense of urgency.

•	Ability to capture and document information accurately, with both concision and attention to detail.

•	Able to prioritise competing tasks and meet deadlines without compromising service quality.

•	Confident and professional phone manner

•	Strong understanding of major Australian cities (knowledge of Melbourne suburbs in Victoria highly preferred)

•	Ability to quickly learn delivery tracking software and CRM systems.

•	Fully equipped home office setup with modern PC (Microsoft Windows 11) and high-speed internet

•	Intermediate to advanced Excel skills, including data management, formulas, reporting, and CSV uploads.

	________________________________________



Primary Responsibilities



•	Maintain and analyse client and delivery data using Excel.

•	Prepare and upload CSV files to tracking systems promptly and efficiently, 

•	Manage and maintain end-client enquiries via phone and
 promptly and efficiently.

•	Review and manage external and internal service agreements to ensure delivery and operational compliance. 

•	Record client requests, delivery details, and operational updates clearly and concisely.

•	Ensure all customer and operational data is accurate, detailed, and easily accessible for reporting or follow-up.

•	Communicate information internally and externally with precision and clarity.

•	Complete additional ad hoc duties as reasonably required.

________________________________________



Purpose of the Role



This position is essential in maintaining and growing client relationships, supporting operational efficiency, and delivering outstanding customer service, making a direct impact on the smooth running of the New Furniture Department.



You can refer to more information on our web site 
 



Hours Of Work - 9am to 5.30pm (30min lunch break) = 8 Hours Per day 

Days of Work - Monday to Friday (Australian Eastern Standard Time)

Role - Full Time with massive potential for growth within the company.



The successful applicant will have excellent training provided by Transcorp in the skillset required.



Interested? Please supply an application and a short video of your experience and why we should interview to hire you. 

Upload your video to the onlinejobs/ph portal.

title: Social Media Content Creator
description:
This Role Is For You If You’re:



- Chronically online (and proud of it)

- Always scrolling, saving, reposting, analyzing

- The friend who just knows why a post went viral

- Fluent in English and confident expressing ideas

- Creative, enthusiastic, and full of good energy

- Lowkey building (or dreaming of building) your own online brand



If social media feels less like “work” and more like second nature, then this is for you! 



What You’ll Be Doing:



You’ll help create, shape, and manage content that’s meant to perform, not just exist.



Your day-to-day includes:

- Creating short-form videos and trendy visual content

- Brainstorming ideas based on what’s viral, aesthetic, and engaging

- Writing captions that sound human (not corporate)

- Staying on top of trends, audios, formats, and Gen Z humor

- Helping grow social media pages through smart, creative content

- Collaborating with a creative team that actually values your ideas



You’ll be trained, supported, and encouraged to bring your own creative voice.





What We’re Looking For:



We’re not obsessed with years of experience. We care more about:



- Genuine love for social media + content creation

- Strong understanding of Gen Z trends and internet culture

- High-level English communication skills

- A good eye for aesthetics and visuals

- Confidence, enthusiasm, and positive energy

- Willingness to learn, experiment, and grow

- Having a personal brand or active social media presence is a bonus, not a requirement.





Why You’ll Love This Role:



- 100% remote (work from anywhere)

- No micromanaging

- Paid training + continuous feedback

- A creative, supportive, non-toxic team

- Opportunities to grow into higher-level creative or strategy roles

- You get paid to do what you already love





How to Apply:



- Send us a short video introduction (1–2 minutes) showing your personality, creativity, and why you’d be a great fit

- Links to your creative portfolio ot any content you’ve created (personal or professional)

- Link to your resume/CV



IMPORTANT:

1. No video intro = not considered

2. Boring or low-effort intro = also a pass

3. Type '67' in your subject line so we know you've read this far



This role is for someone who shows up with personality, creativity, and confidence.



If you read this and thought “wait… this is literally me” — apply now.

We can’t wait to see what you bring!

title: Sales & Tech Representative
description:
We’re Hiring!!!



Are you a skilled salesperson with a background in gas plumbing and/or electrical work? Do you enjoy helping customers find the right solution while using your technical knowledge? Join our growing team and work with a US online home goods retailer that values expertise, professionalism, and customer satisfaction.





Position:

Sales & Tech Representative – Technical Products (Gas & Electrical Focus)

Location: Remote (Philippines-based)

Schedule: Monday-Friday, 11:00 AM to 7:00 PM EST (40 hours/week)

Salary: Competitive + Performance Bonuses





About the Role:

As a Salesperson, you will assist customers with product selection, provide technical support during the sales process, and close sales with confidence. You’ll work with gas fireplaces, heaters, stoves, and other appliances, so previous hands-on experience or technical knowledge of gas or electrical systems is a MUST.





Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Receive incoming phone calls and live chats from potential customers (prospects) who indicated that they need shopping assistance. This does not include calls and chats from existing customers that need help with their orders (that’s a job for a different department)

Help customers choose the right gas or electric heating appliance for their needs

Makes follow-up calls, writes follow-up
s, and text messages to potential buyers. We try to follow up 5x with each person that contacted us (unless they indicate that they are no longer interested). We don’t do cold calling. Only reaching out to prospects who interacted with our online store and left their contact information.

After each interaction with a prospect/customer, writes notes & comments in our CRM (Asana)

Communicate efficiently and build rapport with potential customers

Assists prospects in their shopping journey and helps make the purchase decision

Ensures that all prospects’ questions and objections are addressed

Leads every interaction to a close sale, which means an order is placed on our online store

Prepares custom quotes, price matches competitors if necessary, and offers custom discounts. This requires calculating margins & ensuring profitability.

Answering questions about the products we offer, including technical questions. Learns the specifications, features and benefits of our bestsellers. Over time, becomes an expert in the industry.

Explain technical specifications and installation requirements in simple terms

If not able to answer product-specific questions, conducts research in the materials provided by the supplier, or reaches out to the supplier to get the information

Confirms stock availability and lead times when offering products to prospects

Documents standard procedures and best practices in a written form, so that other tea
mbers can learn from them





Requirements:

Sales Experience – 2+ years, preferably with B2C or B2B technical products

Gas Plumbing or Electrical Experience – Formal training or work experience (installer, technician, or similar roles preferred)

Excellent English – Both written and spoken

Confident Communicator – Can explain complex concepts to non-technical customers

Tech-Savvy – Comfortable using CRMs,
 platforms, order tools, etc.

Reliable and Proactive – Takes initiative and works independently

Home Office Setup – Stable internet, noise-free environment, backup power is a plus





Preferred but Not Required:

Knowledge of venting, HVAC, or hearth appliances

US product or code familiarity

Experience in the construction or home improvement industry





Why Join Us?

Sales commission: 8% of gross profit from all orders closed. Gross profit means the sale amount minus the product and shipping cost. Paid monthly. No upper limit. Monthly commission payouts range between $1,200 (the guaranteed minimum) and as high as $3,000 (for the top performer). The average monthly payout is $1,465 (average from the last 2 years).

$1,200/month minimum guaranteed pay

15 days paid days off per year (also convertible to min. guaranteed commission)

Paid training on all aspects of the role

Opportunities for professional development

Friendly atmosphere

Online Interview process

Fully remote position





How to Apply:

Apply through OnlineJobs.ph with the subject line: "Sales Pro - [Your Name]"

ta ads) and convert them into home consultations.

title: Social Media Content & Marketing Specialist for ecommerce B2C business in USA
description:
We’re a family-owned clothing brand based in the USA (our target audience = moms), looking for a Social Media Content Marketing Specialist to join our team! This is a part-time role (20 hours/week) with potential to transition to full-time based on performance. We’re looking for someone who’s excited to be an A-Player on our team -who shares our enthusiasm and drive to make great things happen together.



Compensation & Benefits:



- $480/month ($6/hr) | ~80 hrs/month (~20 hrs/week) with potential to transition to full-time based on performance.

- Annual bonus (one extra month’s salary after 1 full year of full-time work)

- Performance-based bonuses for successful campaigns

- Flexible hours & remote work

- Training & development opportunities





What We’re Looking For:



- 2+ years experience in social media marketing & content creation

- Time Management & Deadline Focused –- We thrive on organization and meeting deadlines

- Skilled in Reels creation, video editing, and Canva (or similar tools)

- Expert in Instagram &
 growth strategies

- Strong understanding of marketing principles, audience engagement, and analytics

- Ability to work independently, manage time efficiently, and meet performance KPIs

- Strong communication skills for brand partnerships and collaborations

- Availability to monitor social channels, including some evenings/weekends



What You’ll Do:



1. Social Media Brand Management & Content Creation:

We’re looking for someone with ideas and execution skills to ensure our social media presence is engaging and aligned with our brand goals. This role is heavily focused on creating high-performing content that increases engagement and sales.



- Create organic and paid Instagram content, stories, and Reels to drive engagement, following brand aesthetics and messaging.

- Develop and execute a content plan that aligns with monthly brand goals & KPIs while fostering a strong, engaged community. Storytelling skills are a plus!

- Design graphics and write compelling captions to encourage interaction and conversion

- Handle the content calendar, making real-time updates based on content performance and trends

- Ensure all content is optimized based on Meta’s latest algorithm updates. Learning & Staying Updated on Social Trends.

- Research and implement innovative strategies to improve reach and engagement



2. Social Media Growth & Analytics

- Track key metrics for each platform and provide monthly reports with insights and strategies for improvement

- Use data to refine content strategies and implement new ideas for better engagement



3. Community Management

- Actively engage with our community by responding to comments and mentions

- Manage social media “inboxes” to ensure a responsive and engaged brand presence

- Monitor ad comments, assisting with customer inquiries or directing them to the right tea
mber



4. Partnership & Collaboration Management

- Identify and communicate with brand partners, influencers, and content creators

- Organize co-giveaways and brand collaborations to expand brand reach

- Maintain an organized record of all partnerships and track their success





If you’re a creative, data-driven social media content marketer passionate about growing an engaged community, we’d love to hear from you!



How to respond:

1. Reply to this job posting with a link to your resume and example of work you have done

2. In the subject line of your application, include the word “Dress” at the end. Why? This lets us see who is actually paying attention :).

3. Use 8 points to apply. Applications with fewer than 8 points will not be considered.

title: ELITE SHORT-FORM VIDEO EDITOR
description:
ELITE SHORT-FORM VIDEO EDITOR for THE STELLARIS COLLECTION

Luxury Watch Brand | AI Video Specialist | High-Impact Reels/TikTok



THE MISSION

We are The Stellaris Collection.

We are building one of the most dominant luxury watch brands on social media.

Rolex. Patek Philippe. Audemars Piguet. FP Journe. Richard Mille.

Now we’re scaling aggressive short-form content.

This is not normal editing.

This is high-impact, scroll-stopping, retention-engineered video.

If your edits don’t command attention in the first 2 seconds, this role is not for you.



WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

You will turn raw 4K footage into:

• Instagram Reels

• TikToks

• YouTube Shorts

You will:

• Edit 20–30 short-form videos per month (20–60 seconds each)

• Chop long footage into 5–10 viral-ready clips

• Engineer first-2-second hooks that pattern interrupt

• Design fast, clean, intentional transitions

• Create luxury-grade captions and overlays

• Integrate AI-generated video elements seamlessly

• Color grade metals, diamonds, and skin tones properly

• Deliver most edits within 24–48 hours

Some deliveries will be urgent. Days, not weeks.

Speed is part of the job.



AI INTEGRATION IS REQUIRED

You must actively use AI video tools such as:

• Runway

• Sora

• Kling

• Pika

• Veo

• Flow

• Descript

• OpusClip

• Higgsfield

We expect:

• AI-generated motion elements blended into real footage

• Surreal overlays or cinematic enhancements

• Workflow acceleration using AI tools

• Creative experimentation monthly

If you’ve never integrated AI video into real client work, this is not a fit.



HARDWARE REQUIREMENTS (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

You must have:

• High-end workstation

• 32GB+ RAM minimum

• Strong GPU capable of handling 4K timelines

• Reliable fiber-level internet

• Ability to receive and upload 100GB+ project folders

If your computer struggles with heavy timelines, do not apply.



WHAT “ELITE” MEANS HERE

You understand:

• Retention psychology

• Pattern interrupts

• Hook pacing

• Viral structure

• Energy control

• Scroll behavior

You don’t just cut clips.

You build tension.

You control rhythm.

You land impact 
nts.



SUCCESS METRICS (FIRST 90 DAYS)

• 20–30 videos delivered monthly without missed weeks

• 24–48 hour standard turnaround

• 90%+ approval rate with minimal revisions

• Zero footage idle longer than 72 hours

• At least one new AI-driven creative idea per month

• Measurable engagement performance



THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR YOU IF

• You prefer slow cinematic timelines

• You rely heavily on templates

• You resist feedback

• You miss deadlines

• You don’t understand short-form retention

• You’ve never experimented with AI video



COMPENSATION STRUCTURE

Base: $1,200 – $1,500/month

Performance Tier: Up to $1,800/month

Rush Bonus: +$50 same-day delivery

Viral Bonus: $100+ for milestone views

We pay monthly because we want commitment, speed, and brand consistency.



HOW TO APPLY

Send:

1. A Google Drive folder with your best 3 Reels or TikToks

2. One example showing an aggressive 2-second hook

3. A short breakdown of your editing process

4. Software stack

5. Computer specs (CPU, RAM, GPU)

6. Internet upload speed

7. Which AI video tools you actively use

Subject line must be: STELLARIS ELITE VIDEO EDITOR

Finalists will receive raw footage for a paid test edit.



If your portfolio does not immediately feel premium, fast, and retention-focused, you will not be considered.

Passive monitoring without required action is not considered primary work.



If one task queue is complete, you are expected to move to the next assigned task.

Tasks completed



Time spent per task

Ability to follow instructions

Please confirm you are comfortable with this requirement before starting.

Strong written English

? TO APPLY

If there are no new customer
s or tracking updates, what do you do next during your shift?

title: Home Support Worker Manager
description:
Position: Home Support Worker Manager (Domestic Assistance – Aged Care)

Location: Work From Home (Australia)

Hours: Full-time, Monday–Friday, 9:00am–5:00pm (AEST)





 - Why This Role Matters -

At Maid My Day, we believe that how we care for our workers determines how well they care for our clients.



Our Home Support Workers are the heart of our business. They support older Australians to live independently, with dignity, safety, and pride in their homes. Your role is to ensure those workers feel supported, guided, valued, and held to clear standards from day one — and every day after.

This is not a reactive HR role.

It’s a relationship-driven leadership role.



If you love helping people succeed, enjoy setting clear expectations, and take pride in building reliable, long-term teams — keep reading.



 - About Maid My Day - 

Maid My Day is a trusted provider of Domestic Assistance services within the Australian Aged Care sector, operating across Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Canberra, and South Australia.

With over 20 years of experience and a growing workforce of 200+ Home Support Workers, our mission is simple:



Deliver consistent, high-quality care for older Australians

Create meaningful, stable employment pathways for our workers

Build partnerships that last





 - About the Role - 

As the Home Support Worker Manager, you are responsible for what happens after recruitment.



Your focus is to:

Support Home Support Workers as they transition into real-world work

Guide them through training milestones and expectations

Build trust early, address issues quickly, and reinforce what “great” looks like

Help our best people grow into long-term careers - including opportunities with our Aged Care partners



You’ll work closely with:

Our internal leadership team

A team of Virtual Assistants based in the Philippines

Employment consultants and external partners

This role requires empathy with backbone -  you care deeply, communicate clearly, and follow through consistently.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

Supporting Home Support Workers through their early weeks and ongoing employment journey

Ensuring every worker understands expectations, standards, and training milestones

Monitoring performance and addressing issues early, calmly, and professionally

Coaching workers toward “Ideal Employee” status through feedback and encouragement

Preparing high-performing workers for opportunities with our Aged Care partners

Collaborating with employment consultants to ensure progress, compliance, and accountability

Helping refine systems and processes that improve worker retention and performance over time



- What We’re Looking For -

You’ll thrive in this role if you:

Have 3+ years’ experience managing field-based or remote teams

Are naturally supportive but comfortable having firm, respectful conversations

Believe consistency builds trust

Are organised, proactive, and follow through on commitments

Take ownership of outcomes and KPIs

Enjoy being part of a close-knit, values-driven team



Highly regarded experience:

Aged Care, Domestic Assistance, or service-based environments

Google Workspace, Microsoft Outlook, or similar cloud tools





- What We Offer -

A stable, values-led organisation with clear expectations

Full-time, work-from-home role with fixed hours

A supportive leadership team that cares about doing things well

Opportunities to grow with the business and shape how we support our workforce



- How to Apply -

If you’re excited by the idea of supporting people properly, setting clear standards, and building a workforce you’re proud of, we’d love to hear from you.

Please
 Chelle at 
 with:

 - Subject line: Application for HSW Manager

 - Your resume

 - A short note on why this role resonates with you

Immediate Hire: 



We are seeking a highly skilled SEO Product Specialist to join our growing eCommerce team. You will be responsible for optimizing product listings across Etsy, Shopify, and Amazon, ensuring our products rank high and convert effectively. We operate 5 eCommerce stores that require ongoing SEO updates and A+ content creation. You will create graphics, update listings, add new products, update pricing, and more. 



You will be working directly with our team lead/team that is based in the Philippines however, work hours are 10 AM to 3PM CST USA hours 



Responsibilities

Optimize product titles, tags, descriptions, and backend SEO across multiple platforms.

Upload and configure Shopify product listings with SEO-optimized content.

Add products, manage, and update TikTok Seller Central listings.

Create engaging A+ Content (Amazon Enhanced Brand Content) with strong visuals and persuasive copy.

Stay up to date with platform algorithm changes (Etsy SEO, Amazon SEO, Shopify SEO, TikTok SEO).

Collaborate with our remote team on product strategy and performance tracking.

Amazon PPC ads are a plus.  



 Skills & Requirements

Minimum 2-3 years of proven SEO experience (multi-platform preferred).

Strong understanding of Shopify product setup and management.

Knowledge of TikTok Seller Central functions.

Graphic design skills for creating A+ content, banners, and product images. ( Photoshop & Canva) 

Dependable, detail-oriented, and serious about long-term work.

Must have a Wise account for payments.

Must be fluent in English - written and verbal. 





Application Instructions

If you meet the above requirements, please submit all of the following:

Resume

SEO Sample (Etsy, Amazon, Shopify, or TikTok)

Brief Introduction explaining why you are the best fit for this role. Be sure to “sell yourself.” If you can’t sell yourself, how can you sell our products?





 Interview Policy

Interviews will not be conducted without video.





This role is designed for individuals who are committed to building a stable, long-term career and are eager to grow with our team. If that sounds like you, we’re excited to meet you!

title: Onboarding & Support Specialist
description:

 – We’re Hiring an Onboarding & Support

Specialist!

messaging platform that helps them close more deals with less effort.



We’re looking for someone with expertise in A2P (Application-to-Person) messaging setup

and top-tier customer support skills. We need reliable, customer-focused professionals to join

our team as Onboarding & Support Specialists.



If you’re a strong communicator, a problem-solver, and love helping customers succeed — we

want to hear from you!

title: Real Estate Administrative & Client Success Assistant (Remote)
description:
This role is designed to support a top-producing, mission-driven real estate business based in Austin, TX. You’ll act as the backbone of operations — managing contract-to-close details, coordinating vendors, updating clients, and supporting listing prep — while also helping to grow the business through marketing and event coordination.



You’ll work directly with Jay Jay Tolentino (Realtor, Speaker, Coach) and gain inside access to a dynamic, purpose-based brand that blends real estate, education, and personal development.



Key Responsibilities (Approx. 60% of the Role):



Contract-to-Close Operations & Client Servicing



Handle contract-to-close (CTC) communication with buyers, sellers, lenders, and title companies

Send weekly updates to clients with showing feedback, internet traffic, and MLS reports

Follow up with vendors (photographers, inspectors, stagers, cleaners)

Manage Trello board, checklist tasks, and key dates (option period, appraisal, etc.)

Draft amendments and complete listing paperwork as needed

Coordinate key drops, lockboxes, sign installs, and home readiness details

Support agent with phone calls to clients when needed

Additional Responsibilities (Approx. 40% of the Role):



Marketing, Events & Content Coordination



Assist with flyers,
 campaigns, and Just Listed/Sold templates

Support marketing for client events, community partnerships, and vendor collaborations

Help organize social media clips (e.g. from Opus Clips, Zoom, Fathom)

Maintain CRM tagging systems and ensure contacts are added to appropriate SmartPlans

Qualities We’re Looking For:



Strong written and spoken English

MUST HAVE AT LEAST 1 YEAR CTC (Contract-To-Close) EXPERIENCE!

Highly organized and proactive communicator

Tech-savvy (Google Suite, Trello, Zoom, KW Command, Canva, Opus Clips, Fathom)

Emotionally intelligent: can work with someone who is ADHD/neurodiverse

Willing to watch training videos and absorb brand style

Loves improvement, growth, and ownership of tasks

Bonus if you’re into real estate, coaching, or creative marketing!

Details:



Remote option (Ex. considering Philippines-based)

Flexible with US Central Time overlap (ideally 4–8 hours/day)

Pay depending on experience and results

While 60% of this role focuses on contract-to-close operations and 40% supports marketing and contact management, the overarching 100% may be the most important long term — even though it won’t take up the most time on paper. I’m looking for someone who can begin to understand how all the pieces fit together: from listing launch protocols, to client communication systems, to marketing follow-through. This assistant will play a quiet but crucial role in helping me document and improve operations, build a training manual from our existing video library, and gradually help systematize the business. You don’t need to be an ops expert (although preferred) — but if you’re the kind of person who enjoys improving workflows and seeing the big picture, you’ll be set up to grow with the business and become an invaluable part of the team.

title: Global Virtual Assistant
description:
POSITION SUMMARY 

The Global Virtual Assistant provides administrative and operational support to executive leadership. This role is responsible for managing schedules, coordinating team workflows, supporting meetings and events, and ensuring day-to-day administrative functions run smoothly. The ideal candidate is organized, proactive, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple priorities in a professional environment.



This position is 100% remote. 



ABOUT CARDONE VENTURES

Our mission is to help business owners achieve their personal, professional, and financial goals through the growth of their businesses. We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, accountable, transparent, disciplined, aligned, and results-oriented. This company operates nationally and is growing by the day.



Wondering what it's like to work here? Come check this:


/watch?v=PIIv7sYj1Ns



OBJECTIVES 

· Manage executive calendars, scheduling, and meeting coordination.

· Provide general administrative support, including correspondence and document preparation.

· Coordinate internal team workflow scheduling and track deadlines.

· Organize and manage logistics for meetings, events, and conferences.

· Assist with travel arrangements and itinerary planning when needed.

· Maintain organized records and documentation.

· Support special projects and additional administrative tasks as assigned.



COMPETENCIES

· Proven experience in an administrative or executive assistant role.

· Strong organizational and time management skills.

· Excellent written and verbal communication abilities.

· Ability to handle confidential information with professionalism.

· Proficiency with calendar,
, and standard office software tools.

· Ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

• Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer



COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce, Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates, and partners.



If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, please complete the online application form:


/

title: Outbound Sourcing Specialist
description:
Job Overview



Company: Conserva

Location: Remote (Must work according to Eastern Standard Time)

Schedule: Full-time, Monday–Friday, 11AM–8PM EST



About Conserva



Conserva is a forward-thinking company dedicated to administering solar system warranties and services. We pride ourselves on delivering exceptional customer support and high-quality service to our clients, all while fostering an inclusive, remote-first work culture. As we continue to grow, we’re expanding our network of solar service providers—and that’s where you come in.



Position: Outbound Sourcing Specialist



We’re looking for a persuasive, proactive professional to help us scale our operations by identifying, evaluating, and onboarding reliable solar service providers across the U.S. You’ll be on the front lines of Conserva’s growth, building the relationships that keep our service network strong and efficient.



What You’ll Do



* Proactively reach out to solar technicians, electricians, and service companies to introduce Conserva and our partnership opportunities

* Build and manage a pipeline of potential providers using cold calls and follow-ups

* Evaluate vendor proposals and quotes to determine fit, pricing, and capabilities

* Guide qualified providers through the onboarding process and support documentation needs

* Collaborate closely with the operations team to align procurement with service demand and regional needs

* Maintain accurate records and workflows in ClickUp and other internal tools

* Contribute to improving our outreach, onboarding, and vendor relationship strategies



What We’re Looking For



* Strong Communicator: Confident and articulate on the phone and in writing

* Procurement or Sales Background**: Experience in vendor acquisition, sales development, or similar fields preferred

* Relationship Builder: You’re comfortable establishing rapport quickly and can build trust with service providers

* Self-Starter: You’re highly motivated, organized, and capable of working independently in a remote environment

* Problem Solver: You’re comfortable comparing quotes, resolving questions, and thinking on your feet

* Tech-Savvy: You’ll be working in ClickUp, GHL, and ChatGPT daily



Success in This Role Looks Like:



* A growing, high-quality network of solar service providers onboarded

* Consistent volume of outreach and follow-up calls

* Effective coverage of target regions, especially underserved areas

* Quality vendor documentation and CRM data entry



What We Offer



* Competitive Compensation: $1,000 USD per month, paid bi-monthly

* Career Growth: Opportunities for advancement and ongoing training

* Inclusive, Remote-First Environment: Join a global team committed to your success

* Industry Impact: Help scale a business rooted in renewable energy and sustainable solutions



As the first step in your application, please record a short video (1–2 minutes) introducing yourself using [Loom](
/) and include the link in your application message.

title: Proofreader / Copy Editor (Work from home opportunity)
description:
Job description

We are looking for a highly proficient proofreader/editor responsible for maintaining the quality of the SEO content we write for our range of clients. We prefer someone from a journalism and communications background, and the candidate must have an extremely high level of attention to detail. Experience writing for Australian audiences for an agency is a plus. We work across multiple different topic areas with strict deadlines.



Area Ten is a global digital agency that services large corporations to fast-growing upstarts across Australia, Asia and North America. One of the keys to our success lies in the quality of our staff. We have a strict policy of no junior staff which means you’ll be working with the highest calibre of colleagues in the industries, hence there is a scope for ample opportunities to learn and develop.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



·You will have to:



*Acquire and review content briefs, ensuring alignment with client requirements. Develop and manage brand guides and templates to maintain consistency across all content

*Perform end-to-end content editing, from line edits to comprehensive copy edits, ensuring all content meets Area Ten's high standards and client specifications

*Provide constructive feedback to copywriters, manage revisions, and update content based on client feedback to refine and perfect deliverables

*Work closely with a team of editors and content creators, sharing insights and strategies to enhance content quality and workflow efficiency

*Help manage our content database, which requires regular upkeep on the progress of content projects across multiple clients



REQUIREMENTS



*Strong background in content editing and proofreading, preferably within a digital agency setting.

*Exceptional attention to detail and a keen eye for grammatical and stylistic errors. Must be committed to following style guidelines such as the Australian Government Style Manual and the Associated Press Stylebook, 2019.

*Must have a high-speed internet connection and a laptop with high specifications.

*A degree in journalism, communications, or a related field is preferred.

*The resource will also have to experiment with various AI tools and produce quality SEO content for our partner clients. This is a full-time role and involves closely working with the other editors and the rest of the team.



Mandate Requirement: The candidate should have a high-speed internet connection and a laptop with high computer specifications.



Please note: You will have to complete 1 copy test and 1 proofreading exercise as a part of the interview process.



ELIGIBILITY:



· Proofreading: 2 years (Required)



· Copywriting: 5 years (Required)



HOW TO APPLY:



If you’re interested in a role with us, please answer this:



Job Type: Full-time, Permanent



Benefits:



Work from home

title: Zoho Specialist
description:
Who We Are



Evo Tech Software Solutions Inc. is a highly motivated team of professionals based in Cebu, Philippines, committed to providing tailored services. With expertise in Web Development, e-Commerce Management, Data Analytics, and Graphic Design, we offer globally competitive solutions that empower our clients’ businesses to excel in today’s market.



By design, we combine your vision for your brand with our creative and technical capabilities to design the right user experience. We make sure that your customers or users discover your product not only appealing, but also useful.



Empowering your company with cutting-edge software solutions. Our skilled team adapts to tech trends, ensuring your excellence in innovation through development.



With BPO, we aim to enhance efficiency and service delivery with our versatile business support. We evolve to offer swift, improved customer service solutions.



The Opportunity (Onsite)

We are seeking a skilled Zoho Specialist to configure, customize, and optimize Zoho applications to support business operations. The ideal candidate has hands-on experience with Zoho CRM and other Zoho One apps, strong automation skills, and the ability to translate business requirements into efficient system solutions.



Key Responsibilities

• Configure, customize, and maintain Zoho CRM (modules, fields, layouts, workflows)

• Implement and manage Zoho applications such as: Zoho CRM, Zoho Creator, Zoho Books/Billing, Zoho Desk, Zoho Campaigns, Zoho Projects, Zoho Analytics

• Build and optimize workflows, automations, blueprints, and approval processes

• Develop custom functions using Deluge scripting

• Integrate Zoho with third-party tools (Google Workspace, payment gateways, marketing platforms, APIs)

• Design dashboards and reports to support decision-making

• Perform data migration, data cleanup, and system audits

• Provide user training, documentation, and ongoing support

• Troubleshoot system issues and recommend improvements

• Ensure data accuracy, security, and best practices





Skills & Qualifications

• Proven experience as a Zoho Specialist or Zoho Administrator

• Strong knowledge of Zoho CRM and Zoho One ecosystem

• Experience with Deluge scripting

• Understanding of CRM concepts, sales pipelines, and business workflows

• Experience with integrations and APIs

• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

• Excellent communication and documentation skills



Nice To Have

• Experience with custom apps in Zoho Creator

• Knowledge of accounting tools (Zoho Books, QuickBooks, Xero)

• Familiarity with marketing automation and customer support systems

• Experience working with remote or distributed teams



If you’re passionate about building efficient systems, enjoy solving complex business challenges, and have deep expertise in the Zoho ecosystem, we’d love to hear from you. Join our team and play a key role in optimizing our operations through smart, scalable Zoho solutions!

title: Real Estate Listing Coordinator
description:

Selling LA Luxury | Compass Real Estate

Remote | 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM PST

$5/hour + $20 per closed listing managed



About Us

Selling LA Luxury is a high-performing real estate team based in Los Angeles, affiliated with Compass. We specialize in luxury listings, strategic marketing, and white-glove client service.

We operate with precision, speed, and excellence.

We are seeking a highly organized, detail-obsessed Virtual Listing Coordinator to manage listings from pre-appointment preparation through closing and beyond.

This is a full-time, long-term role for someone who wants to grow with a fast-scaling real estate team.



Role Overview

The Virtual Listing Coordinator (VLC) manages every stage of the listing lifecycle, including:

• Appointment preparation

• Listing agreement preparation

• Compass CRM compliance

• Compass Business Tracker compliance

• MLS input + listing activation

• Zillow Showcase management

• Vendor coordination (photo, video, staging)

• Weekly seller reporting

• Escrow oversight in collaboration with Transaction Coordinator

• Closing management + post-closing follow-up

• Weekly Open House Scheduling with Team and ensuring all marketing material is prepared and sent to agents

This role requires strong attention to detail and strict adherence to deadlines.



Core Responsibilities

Order official title report

Ensure agent pulls comps

mbers as collaborators
